datosGenerales.descripcion: 'Fournier' Playing Cards Museum and the Museum of Archaeology have merge to create Bibat. The building, located in the Old Town of Vitoria-Gasteiz, consists of four floors, two basements and owns approximately 250 packs of cards and1.500 playing cards. Regarding the section focusing on archaeology, it is home to a summary of Álava's history from its origins in the Palaeolithic until the founding of medieval towns, as well as an approach to the archaeological method. The exhibitions are organised chronologically, beginning in the Palaeolithic and finishing in the Middle Ages. The collection goes over the Neolithic and the dolmens, the Megalithic Age in general and the burial caves; the Bronze Age, the Iron Age with thematic exhibitions such as The House of the Iron Age in Álava. As to card games, the new museum houses a card collection compiled by Félix Alfaro Fournier, considered the most important lot in the world for many people. 250 packs of cards are divided according to subjects and explanations of their manufacturing and different types of games are given.

datosGenerales.nombre: Lantern Museum of Virgen Blanca Brotherhood
datosGenerales.descripcion: This original museum houses the 267 pieces of polychrome glass, which have been on show during the procession through the centre of Vitoria-Gasteiz to celebrate the Virgen Blanca festival every 4th August for over a hundred years. It opened as a museum in 2000, when the restoration was completed of all the elements of the Procession and the building in which they were stored.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Natural Science Museum of Alava offers an interesting museographic offer made up by botanic, paleontological, mineralogical and zoological collections. Along with these, an important bibliographic collection, where the periodic scientific magazines exceed one thousand titles.

 

The important photographic collection -in classical and digital format- completes the heritage of the newest Natural Science Museum in the Country that has been preserved, researched and spread. The museum is located in the Doña Otxanda tower and consists of three floors.

 

Physically handicapped people can only access the first floor.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Visitors to the Artium Museum, Museum of Contemporary Art of the Basque Country of Vitoria-Gasteiz can see works from its collection on show.

 

Its breadth and the artists represented in it make this collection a landmark to discover Basque and Spanish contemporary art from the 1950s to the present. It also hosts temporary exhibitions devoted to different generations of Spanish and international artists.

 

Artium Museoa features distinctive architecture: most of its exhibition space is below ground level. Outside it, on the other hand, works by Richard Serra, Jorge Oteiza and Eduardo Chillida can be seen. Artium Museoa is a kind of museum in a cellar where the most valuable contents are not evident at first glance.

 

Artium Museoa is also a museum suitable for all ages, in which families are especially welcome, with the possibility of joining in activities and using spaces provided specifically for them.

 

Check the museum agenda: activities.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Arms Museum provides visitors with a chronological exhibition. It begins with prehistoric arms and tools to finish with uniforms and other contemporary harnesses, without forgetting the space for the exhibition of Eastern and Arabic weapons, along with some weapons from central Africa.

 

The prehistoric weapon section shows bifaces and arrow tips coming from Spain, America and Africa. The collection includes Greek and Roman weapons; medieval arms, armours, swords, knifes; war elements used at the Battle of Vitoria; military uniforms.

datosGenerales.nombre: Museum of the Archaeological Site of Iruña-Veleia
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The archaeological site of Iruña-Veleia covers over 1,500 years of history. From the first millennium before Christ until the 5th century after Christ, to be precise.

 

The site is a wide settlement of a surface area of 80 hectares containing potential remains of which 10 hectares belong to the late Roman city. Abundant archaeological remains, presence of protohistoric cultures, Roman culture (the first half of the Roman Empire and fall of Rome), and an epigraphic fragment from the 5th-9th centuries.

 

What is more, most part of the wall remains visible as well as the southern gate to the fortified settlement. A small reception centre provides graphic information and brochures to contextualise the tour. In addition, activities such as "La pieza de la temporada" (Season item) are arranged to show the latest finds.

 

Besides, there are also information panels and educational boards spread all over the place and a recommended tour perfectly marked and accompanied by a specific guide-map.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Fine Arts Museum of Alava is located in the Augustin-Zulueta Palace in the nice Paseo de Fray Francisco, very next to the center of Vitoria-Gasteiz. A building of 100 years that emphasizes for its beauty surrounded from gardens, willows and staircases.

 

At present and after an important reform, one dedicates to the Spanish art of the XVIIIth to XXth centuries, with Works belonging to the Provincial Government of Alava, deposits of the Prado Museum and of the Foundation Fernando de Amárica. The ground floor is dedicated to the Basque art of the period 1850-1950 with authors like Antonio Mª de Lecuona, Juan Angel Sáez, José Echenagusia or Eduardo Zamacois, between others.

 

On the first floor there are paintings of big size of Basque artist like Ignacio Zuloaga, Ramón y Valentín de Zubiaurre or Elías Salaverria. A room is dedicated to Ignacio Díaz Olano, costumbrist painter who cultivated the portrait, still life and the scenery. It’s possible to enjoy works of this artist of alava as excellent as “Amor en el bosque”, “Rezo del Ángelus en el campo”, “el restaurante” or “Vuelta de la Romería del Calvario”. On the second floor there are three rooms devoted to Fernando de Amárica distributed in chronological order being able to observe its evolution across the realism, impressionism and expressionism.

 

The museum also includes temporary Works with internal and external funds.

datosGenerales.nombre: Villa Lucía. Thematic Center of the wine
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Villa Lucia is an innovative and surprising theme Center designed to enjoy, savor and disseminate the culture of wine. The building consists of several meeting rooms, a library, a wine cellar and a museum-cellar. The building is located in an ancient country estate and belongs to the family of fabulist Samaniego, in Laguardia. 

 

The visit to the centre includes an interactive tour showing the wine making process by means of virtual tastings, games, and so on. Tasting courses, tastings and gastronomic gymkhanas at the clients' disposal throughout the year.

 

The Villa Lucía wine centre is the first establishment of its kind to earn Equalitas Vitae certification as an Inclusive Museum with 100% accessibility.

 

The museum belongs to the Basque network of food and drink museums.

datosGenerales.nombre: The Diocesan Museum of Sacred Art
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Diocesan Museum of Sacred Art is a place where you can learn all about the past and its art forms.

 

The museum opened its doors in 1999 and aims to protect, preserve, study and disseminate Álava's religious heritage. Its collection originates from loans, donations and purchases from Álava Provincial Council, the Vitoria-Gasteiz Diocese and the churches of the Diocese. The collection is divided into five broad sections, which are ordered according to five materials and techniques, corresponding with some of the major styles in the history of art.

 

Some of the treats you can enjoy include stelas, Romanesque sculptures, Gothic carvings of Andra Maris and saints, Flemish triptychs, Renaissance altarpieces, and baroque paintings from artists such as El Greco, Alonso Cano, Gaspar de Crayer and Juan Carreño de Miranda, as well as gold and silver pieces from the period between the 13th and 20th centuries.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The permanent exhibitions gather large information about every historical stage of the Basque police: uniforms, photography, armaments, documents and memorabilia that depict past events, from the founding of the "Ertzaña" in 1936 up to the present time.

 

The collection is based on interactive and audiovisual aids, as well as on a computerised multimedia network. The museum also captures information about other police forces.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
At the 'Usatxi' Ethnographic Museum in Pipaón, visitors will learn about how people lived at the end of the 19th century and the beginning of the 20th century.

 

The museum centres on the town of Pipaón and the working lives of its inhabitants. It also incorporates aspects of daily and home life and the customs which formed an essential part of this rural society.

 

There are exhibits of tools and utensils which were used by people at work and at home, typical outfits and other items which reflect Pipaón's customs, games, parties and rituals.

A modern building for temporary exhibitions and an outdoor amphitheatre for cultural performances complete the showing.

datosGenerales.descripcion: La Hoya Museum contains a clear and didactic view of the environment in which the inhabitants of this area evolved throughout a millennium (1200 b. C. - 250 b. C.). Two types of museum resources have been used as follows: photographs, drawings, texts and a model of the village during the 2nd Iron Age.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Basque Pottery Museum is located in the Ollerías neighbourhood, in Elosu. The Museum is located in a beautiful natural setting, between the Urkiola Natural Park and the Gorbeia Natural Park, by the shores of Alava's reservoirs. The building is an old restored pottery that is open to the public since 1993. Pieces mainly made in the Basque Country, and others made in other potteries around the peninsula make up the exhibition.

 

Pieces are organised according to their use and function: cooking pots, table pottery, water transport and storage, slaughter of pigs and preservation of food, religious and decorative use, building and accessories, and so on. The permanent exhibition houses a total of 380 pieces. Tours of the production workshop are available, giving visitors the chance to observe the potters at work.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The museum depicts the life, customs, curiosities and anecdotes of Rioja Alavesa over the last few centuries. The 219.88 sq. metre museum is structured into seven topics: agriculture -harvest, haulage...-, livestock farming, trades -shoe making, carpentry...-, weights and measurements, transport and domestic life -bread making, household chores...- and religious vestments -chasubles, capes...-.

 

Some of the items were produced in workshops from Toledo in the 18th century. Besides, the hall holds an exhibition of Giralda III. In all, 297 items comprise the collection. Admission free.

 

Collections: 297 items depicting the life, customs, curiosities and anecdotes of Rioja Alavesa over the last few centuries. Clothing, working tools, furniture, religious vestments, and so on.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Located in a 18th century building that used to be devoted to salvage and monitoring port activity.

In 2007 the Naval Museum restored its exhibition area, and the two main floors devoted to the permanent exhibitions have become halls for long-term collections.

The top floor houses smaller-scale exhibitions and educational workshops, as well as a specialist library which is open to everyone who is interested in consulting its archives.

The objective of the museum is to contribute to the preservation, study and dissemination of the Basque Country's maritime history and heritage.

datosGenerales.nombre: San Sebastián Aquarium - Palacio del Mar
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Three exhibition areas make up the Aquarium. Firstly, an Oceanarium with a 360-degree methacrylate tunnel where sharks are the most remarkable species. The second hall displays oceanographic collections, and the last area focuses on the local sea history.

Aiming to count on the active participation of the visitors, the Aquarium-Palacio del Mar of Donostia-San Sebastián provides a comprehensive activities' programme where guided tours, immersions, programme "Sleeping among fish" -to get familiar with the night sea world-, and conferences should be highlighted, among many others.

Collections: Tropical aquariums and oceanarium with a tropical river, Caribbean and Indo Pacific reefs, pelagic fish species, aquarium where fish species can be touched, moray eels, micro worlds and dangerous species.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Inaugurated in 1902, the San Telmo Museum is the oldest museum of the Basque Country.

It has been reopened in 2011, after a five-year restoration and extension process. It is the biggest museum dedicated to the interpretation of Basque society, from prehistory to the present. The old building was a Dominican monastery built in the 16th century. The new pavilion was built below Mount Urgull, and it houses temporary exhibitions, among others.

The Museum has a 11,000 square meter display space and contains more than 26,000 art pieces; a selection of them is shown in several exhibition segments: Traces in Memory, The Awakening of Modernity and The Historical Art Collection. In addition, the video called From monastery to museum explains the evolution of San Telmo.

On the other hand, in the tower of the monastery there is a space called The Museum of Gipuzkoan Museums, which contains information about the centres forming the Gipuzkoa Museum Network.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Science Museum is located in a natural environment within the Miramón Technology Park in San Sebastián, 10 minutes away from the city centre.

It is a scientific centre of over 8,000m2 that is accessible for all ages and where the visitor can play with their sensations via interactive systems.

Added to the permanent exhibition with over 169 models, the Museum also has a Animalia zone for general public, where you can see different ecosystems and the animals (rainforest snakes, desert lizards and salt water fish ) that inhabit them in an effort to understand the importance of preserving our natural environment. There are guided activities every weekend, a digital Planetarium with a varied programme, and a play area of 300m² with all sorts of simulations to take visitors off into a world of sensations.

Guided tours are available, you can make your hair stand on end in the Electricity theatre, or lie on the Fakir’s bed with its 10,000 nails. A digital Planetarium with a varied programme of activities designed for families and astronomy enthusiasts, a place where you can set off in 3D through the Solar System occupying the entire dome.

Lastly, a play area of 300m² with all sorts of simulations will take visitors off into a world of sensations. Among the newest introductions you’ll find an F1 car, a Maxflight flight simulator and an Orion Spacecraft.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
D'Museoa is the San Sebastián diocesan museum, specialised in religious artworks.

Its origins lie in the major exhibition of liturgical and Eucharistic art organised in May 1946.

In the 60s and 80s, Manuel Lekuona and José María Zunzunegui scoured parish archives and sacristies in churches, chapels, monasteries and parochial houses in search of the imprint of religious history in the form of works of art. Thanks to their efforts and to restoration and conservation work, the pieces found have made it possible to recover a collective memory that reflects the history of the Basque people through their religious feeling.

The Museum today has a permanent collection made up of over 150 works of art (sculpture, painting and metalwork). They are mediaeval, modern and contemporary artworks, displayed in more than 400 square metres of floor space. Moreover, the Museum has several rooms devoted to temporary exhibitions.

In 2016 the Diocesan Museum was reopened in its new location on the Calle 31 de Agosto.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Larraul Ecomuseum opened in 2009. It aims to contribute to the economic and social development of Larraul and the Aiztondo valley by generating and disseminating knowledge about these places and restoring their heritage. It represents a move away from the traditional museum concept.

 

At the Larraul Ecomuseum, the land, residents, and visitors all contribute to fostering sustainable ways of life. The centre offers people a close-up view of the Tolosaldea region as it is today, and helps us to understand the transformations which Basque rural life has undergone over the past number of decades.

 

Larraulgo Ecomuseum hosts a variety of workshops, including bread- and biscuit-making, woodcarving, ointments, soap-making and clay pottery.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Museum Cemento Rezola is dedicated to the history of cement and includes several themed areas that explore manufacturing through the ages.

Its mission is to explain the important role that this substance has played in our civilisation, and the museum therefore takes visitors on an educational journey to the world of cement. How cement is made, its relationship with the environment, and its applications for engineering, architecture and art, are just some of the themes explored.

Visitors can also take part in our programme of educational workshops.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
D'elikatuz is a diet and gastronomy centre for children and adults that is located in Ordizia. It consists of two thematic areas: world diet and Basque Country gastronomy throughout time, apart from many general contents about food, fairs and markets, Basque cuisine, gastronomic societies and cider houses.

 

This is a place where it is possible to know textures, flavours, and where conferences are given about food, well-balanced diets, food disorders, and so on. D'elikatuz offers a large room to temporary exhibits and in the middle of the space we will find concerts, conferences, campaigns and similar issues.

 

The project embraces education, research and spreading, and raises inhabitants' interest on food and gastronomy, as well as increases their knowledge about those topics and organise activities to encourage healthy diet. Moreover, the ground floor houses the Goierri Interpretation Centre, which enables getting to know in depth this region.

 

Tickets: 3 Euro. 2 Euro for children under 12 years and groups of over 10 people. Free entrance to multipurpose room. Temporary exhibitions: Mycology exhibit, high quality food, pasturage and many issues throughout the year. Permanent exhibitions: Diet and nutrition. Gastronomy. Agenda: Exhibitions, concerts, conferences, campaigns, lectures. Consult web. Children's agenda: Didactic units adapted for every course. The gastronomy centre belongs to the Basque network of food and drink museums.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Chillida-Leku Museum houses the largest, most representative body of work by Eduardo Chillida.

Chillida-Leku is a museum founded by the artist who created The comb of the Wind during his lifetime after fifteen years spent restoring and fitting out the Zabalaga farmstead on the outskirts of Hernani, just a short distance from San Sebastián. The sculptor was seeking a home for his work - a "place" (in Basque, leku) - where future generations would be able to discover and experience his art in an unparalleled setting.

Within the building are located works of smaller sizes, such as drawings and even his first chest sculptures. But the real nature is found outdoors, where not only his most beloved sculptures are displayed but also the essence of his work.

This historic building dating from the 16th century is set in 11 hectares of land in which nearly 40 original sculptures by the artist can be seen, highlights among them including Buscando la luz I (Seeking the Light I, 1997) and Lotura XXXII (1998), made in weathering steel, a material strongly redolent of the region's industrial past.

From 2011 to 2019 it has been closed to the general public and could only be visited by prior appointment. In April 2019 it is to reopen its doors after a modernisation process led by the Argentinean architect Luis Laplace, known for his respectful, sustainable restoration and interior design work, closely linked to art in its execution. The architect Jon Essery Chillida, Eduardo Chillida's grandson, and the Dutch landscape architect Piet Oudof took part in the renovation process alongside Laplace.

Collection: Chillida-Leku collection consists of 391 sculptures and over 300 paper works such as gravitations, carvings and drawings.

Permanent exhibitions: Sculptures and other works by Eduardo Chillida made of steel-iron, alabaster, stainless steel, stone, concrete, wood, paper, earth, flint and felt.

Prices:

  • €14 for adults
  • €10 for groups of more than 10 people, students, people aged over 65
  • €7 for under-18s, person with disability, unemployed

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Zumalakarregi Museum is accommodated in the Iriarte Erdikoa House, home to the well-known Zumalacárregui family, which most outstanding members were Carlist general Tomás Zumalakarregi and his brother Miguel, a liberal politician. It is a reference centre for the study of the 19th century Basque Country.

 

The museum provides the biographies of the Zumalacárregui Brothers, as well as data about the First Carlist War, an information contextualised in the difficult and violent transition from the Ancien Régime to Liberalism, between the French Revolution and the Second Carlist War.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Luberri Geological Interpretation Centre offers a unique chance to find the geological and paleontological wealth located in the valley of Oiartzun. The foundation is situated within the Oarsoaldea region, in the Aiako Harria Natural Park. The centre arranges an unusual journey in time throughout the last 1 billion years. Thanks to it we will discover the geological history of our lands.

 

Luberri consists of several thematic spaces and 40 showcases in which the visitors will be able to admire fossils, minerals and a wide range of geological materials from Gipuzkoa and many areas of the Basque geography. Exhibition panels are available in Spanish, Basque and French to provide the visitors with the information about the characteristics, origins and the place where the elements were found.

 

"Roca, Mineral y Fósil" area intends to show the main rudiments of geology, types of fossils, minerals and rocks that can be found in our lands, among many other subjects. Furthermore, the area called "Historia geológica de Euskal Herria" enables to go deep into our mountains' evolution throughout the past 500 million years. To come across the most ancient settlers of Gipuzkoa, the most important fossils of different periods of the geological era and the granitic batolito (the only structure of this type in our geography) enter the area named Oiartzun. The museum also provides a zone that focuses on the recent finds.

 

Likewise, Luberri consists of a small workshop-laboratory where those who visit it will have the possibility to observe the way the experts of the museum work.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Historical Monuments of Igartza are located at the entrance to Beasain, on the Way of St. James' inland route.

 

The complex is made up of various buildings and constructions: the Palace, the chapel, the mill, the miller's home, the ironworks, the blacksmith's home with the stables, the apple press and the bridge.

 

Igartza dates back to the 12th century, when, in place of today's palace, a defensive tower house once stood tall. This was in keeping with that period in history, which was marked by wars and instability among the noble families. The Lords of Igartza built the palace in the 16th century and surrounded it with the necessary services: the mill, the ironworks, the press, the stables, etc. These constructions make up what are known today as the Historical Monuments of Igartza.

 

Igartza Palace, which one can further explore by going on a guided visit, today stages a variety of activities, such as exhibitions and conferences.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The beauty of nearly 7000 worldwide butterfly species is available at the permanent exhibition Worldwide Butterflies. Manuel Aguirresarobe, founder of the exhibition, sold his work to the Irun City Council in 2006.

 

Butterflies from the Spanish State and the Basque Country making up the collection have been caught by Manuel Aguirresarobe. Other worldwide species are result of the collaboration between colleagues or institutions from different areas of the world. Each species bears a descriptive card including the main features of the butterfly.

 

The tour rounds off with a screening of a documentary on the butterflies' biological cycle. Collections: World butterflies and a documentary on the butterflies' biological cycle.

datosGenerales.nombre: Idiazabal Cheese Tasting and Interpretation Centre
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Cheese Tasting and Interpretation Centre, of informative nature, shows the whole history about the Idiazabal Cheese.

 

Shepherds that have been settled down in the Basque Country over generations elaborate this cheese with raw milk of latxa sheep from Karrantza. The centre is situated on a 210-sq. metres ground floor divided into several thematic areas that enable getting to know deeply shepherds' world -from ancient times to nowadays-, the process in situ of cheese making and the chance to taste it in the very centre.

 

Therefore, the centre houses Izal's family. Izal is a nice mouse that, by means of a virtual tour, will show us the history of cheese. Other rooms expose information about different denomination cheeses and a reproduction of a traditional shepherd's "txabola" (hut) with its furniture, fittings and tools.

 

To stimulate the senses of smell and taste, the visitors will smell four different cheeses' aromas, apart from an initiation tasting with the help of audiovisual software of tactile screen and guided by the centre staff. To finish, a guided tour to Quesería Aramburu is arranged. This is an authentic cheese factory located a few metres from the centre.

 

The Cheese Tasting and Interpretation Centre belongs to the Basque network of food and drink museums.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The museum shows the salt-production facilities used for centuries in Leintz-Gatzaga, an industry that is closely related to the foundation of the town and to its economic development throughout history. 

 

The museum describes the history of salt miners in the very place where the salt was extracted, thanks to the effort made to preserve and reconstruct some of its most significant elements.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Lenbur project (Legazpi Nature and Iron) began as an initiative of Legazpi Town Council to promote the natural and cultural heritage of the region, specially the one related to the history of iron, in order to contribute to the economic and social development of the area.

 

The visitor will become involved in the everyday life of the 50's and discover the functioning of the old ironworks. The Mirandaola Park (Legazpi), rebuilt and running on Sundays as 6 centuries ago, its ironworks and the Basque Iron Museum are the starting point of the Lenbur Territory Museum. Others settled in farmhouses are the Shepherding Ecomuseum, where cheese is made, the Bread Corner and AIKUR-Bee Museum. In addition, "the Workers Route" invites you on a journey to the 50s, to a schoolroom, a house and a chapel, to be precise.

 

Thus, through the heritage elements that compose the Lenbur Territory Museum, the centre attempts to explain the connection of the Basques with its environment taking the industrial development related to iron as the central axis and thread.

datosGenerales.nombre: D'elikatuz, the Interpretation Centre of Goierri
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Interpretation Centre of Goierri makes use of models, diaporamas, real and photographic materials to explain the region's main characteristics and the elements that can be named as of tourist interest.

 

Thus, the visitors will have the possibility to enjoy the most outstanding historical monuments, the landscape, the traditions, Aralar and Aizkorri Natural Parks, the areas that make up the region, and several routes across the main tourist spots such as the Way of St. James, the route of Estanda Valley, etc. and the chance to practise active tourism.

 

The centre is divided into 5 sections: Nature, Traditions and Folklore, Arts and History, Routes and the region of Goierri village by village. Moreover, guided tours are available to visit the D'elikatuz Centre, the Old Town of Ordizia and all day long trips for groups of over 20 people: the Route of the Idiazabal Cheese, Route of the Ordizia Fair and its products, as Medieval Goierri.

 

Tickets:

3,20 Euro. Permanent Exhibitions: Nature, Traditions and Folklore, Arts and History, Routes and the region of Goierri village by village. Events: Exhibitions, concerts, conferences, campaigns, talks. Consult web. Events for the children: Didactic units adapted to each school course.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Ekoetxea Azpeitia is a museum based on different aspects of the environment.

 

Visitors to its four exhibition rooms can learn about and appreciate natural resources through themed blocks dealing with issues such as climate change, atmosphere, water, biodiversity, population, cities, bioclimatic architecture, sustainable town planning, mobility, energy and transport, noise, waste and consumption and sustainable development.

 

This museum in Azpeitia can be visited independently or by arrangement with its mediation department. In fact the museum runs a full range of activities related to the environment, for the public and for schools. 

 

For families, Ekoetxea Azpeitia has a wide range of free activities at the weekend. Another of its attractions is Xaguxatar, the first urban nature park devoted to the Basque Country's natural heritage. The park covers 1,800 square metres and is divided into five areas:

  • Garden of Vertical Trunks
  • Maze
  • Xaguxatar Wall
  • Insect Hotel
  • Alternative space.

datosGenerales.descripcion: Eskoriatza Museum School was created in 1986, and was originally housed in the Town Hall. Later, the same Town Hall acquired Ibarraundi Palace (which dates back to the 15th century and belonged to the Galartza family) and decided to move the museum there. In 2005 the Eskoriatza Museum School changed its name to the Ibarraundi Museum. The Ibarraundi Museum aims to protect, study and disseminate knowledge about Eskoriatza's historical and ethnographic heritage; it also strives to become a centre which promotes the expression and study of Eskoriatza's culture as well as that of the valley of Leniz. The museum houses a permanent exhibition, focusing on history and ethnography, and also hosts temporary exhibitions.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Basque Railway Museum of Azpeitia offers an insight into the Basque Country's railway history, by means of an exhibition of more than sixty trains which have been completely restored and are now in working order: steam locomotives, urban tramways, passenger and merchandise carriages, trolleybuses, etc.

It charts the evolution of this mode of transport throughout 150 years of history. In addition, visitors will have the chance to view collections of railway clocks, machine-tools, uniforms, lanterns, etc.

It is one of the most important museums of its type in Europe.

For several months, visitors will have the opportunity to make the trip from Azpeitia to Lasao (5 kilometres) in a steam train.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The museum's first set of mineral and fossil exhibits comes from a private collection that was transferred by Mr Nicolás Aguado to the Urretxu Town Council.

 

Visitors can admire around 1,000 crystallised minerals, as well as fossils that illustrate the different geological periods that go from the beginning of life on Earth to the Pleistocene, just at the beginning of the Quaternary Period (plants, fish species, echinoids, etc.).

 

Collections: Minerals from all over the world and fossils from all periods. Schedules: Walks. A fair, talks and special exhibitions in October. Children schedules Walks and storytelling performances on nature in May and November.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Ignacio Zuloaga Cultural Space comprises various buildings which showcase the life and work of the celebrated painter from Eibar. In the study-workshop, built by Zuloaga himself as a place for painting, personal objects belonging to the artist have been preserved, in addition to some of his artwork.

 

Housed in the historical collection museum, also erected by the painter, are the art collections of Zuloaga, and of his wife Valentine Dethomas, as well as pieces inherited from his father, Plácido Zuloaga. Among the paintings in this collection, which span the period between the 12th and 20th centuries, are pieces by Rodin, Zurbarán, Goya and El Greco.

 

The collection is completed by a Roman chapel, which was reconstructed by Zuloaga between 1910 and 1920 and which houses the Christ on the Cross by Julio Beobide and a picture of the Lady of Sorrows, by Quintín Torres, both polychromed by Ignacio Zuloaga.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Algorri Interpretation Centre helps visitors to understand the Zumaia cliffs and tidal plain, a privileged natural setting. The imposing cliffs at Zumaia constitute one of the most significant, well-known geological sanctuaries in the world.

 

Besides this geological treasure, Zumaia also features remarkable examples of different Cantabrian formations and ecosystems, including the impressive Deba-Zumaia tidal plain (declared a protected biotope), the Santiago dunes, the Artadi oak forest and the Bedua islands and marshlands. Algorri features an exhibition focusing on this natural setting, including audiovisual materials, educational workshops, a laboratory, a library and guided tours (on foot and/or by boat) to discover the area first hand (tours on Saturdays).

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Igartubeiti farmhouse, acquired by Gipuzkoa Provincial Council in 1992, which carried out a complete restoration of the building, is an exponent of wooden architecture from the 16th and 17th centuries and is a faithful reflection of the Golden Age of the Basque farmhouse.

 

The farmhouse boasts a fully-functioning lagar (apple press) from the 16th century. Visitors will have the chance to see the lagar, and will be able to enjoy the aroma of pressed apples, grass, drying skins and smoke from the hearth. The tour also invites visitors to come and explore the dimly-lit kitchen and the stables.The wooden floors in the attic creak under our footsteps.

 

The house is uninhabited, however, and there is no-one here who is able to regale us with stories about what happened here before and after that golden age. The Interpretation Centre plays an important role in allowing us to relive the history of Basque farmhouses over more than one thousand years. By listening to the family and neighbours of Igartubeiti, we discover how the old farmhouses grew and evolved, how their inhabitants lived and worked, their relationships with each other, their beliefs, what they produced, what they ate, what they did for fun and the hardships they faced.

 

The museum belongs to the Basque network of food and drink museums.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Photomuseum. Argazki & Zinema Museoa sets off on a journey through the history of art and photography techniques, starting from the very beginning and brining us right up until the present day.

 

It houses a vast and varied collection of photography equipment, old daguerreotypes and artistic photographs from all eras and genres. In addition, it boasts a library and newspaper library which are dedicated to the world of photography.

 

The permanent exhibition is divided into three sections: History of technical photography; Photography genres; and Uses of photography.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Turned into the symbol of the new Bilbao, Guggenheim Bilbao Museum presents one of the most ambitious cultural projects of the century.

The permanent collection includes basically works of art of the most prominent artists of the second half of the 20th century, which is supplemented by exhibits lent by the Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation and special programmes sponsored by the Foundation. Besides, some of the rooms are devoted to monographic exhibitions while others accommodate works specifically commissioned for the museum.

Contemporary Basque and Spanish State art is also represented through a selection of works, which consist of new acquisitions to the museum's permanent collection

They provide a large view of the most up-to-date art tendencies. The Guggenheim Bilbao boasts its own, singular collection, and also compliments the other Guggenheim institutions' collections throughout the world. The museum's holdings include pieces by some of the most important artists of the second half of the 20th century, such as Eduardo Chillida, Yves Klein, Willem de Kooning, Robert Motherwell, Robert Rauschenberg, James Rosenquist, Clyfford Still, Antoni Tàpies and Andy Warhol, to name but a few.

With regards the permanent exhibitions, the following pieces stand out in particular: Richard Serra's The Matter of Time, Jenny Holzer's Installation for Bilbao, Jeff Koons' Puppy, Yves Klein's Fire Fountain, Louise Bourgeois' Maman, Jeff Koons' Tulips, Daniel Buren's Arcos rojos and Fujiko Nakaya's Fog Sculpture.

The Guggenheim Bilbao Museum, in addition to exhibitions, also houses concerts, festivals, conferences, screenings and workshops. Find out what exhibitions and events are on at the Museum.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
It is situated in the heart of the Pagoeta nature park, near the hamlet of Iturraran.

The ironworks and mill complex is made up of the Agorregi ironworks and four mills, as well as a whole infrastructure of reservoirs, dams and channels.

A place that has withstood the passing of time and is home to a centuries-old tradition that represents Basque culture to perfection.

Nowadays, as 250 years ago, visitors can see how the iron was hammered and shaped, and admire the enormous bellows powered by hydraulic energy that was used to get the fire going. It also attracts attention the multi level reservoir system, which is very original and effective. Permanent exhibitions: Ironworks, mills and dams. 

But Agorregi is far from being an antiquated place. The vitality of the water that rushes beside it and which has been so important to the place is reinforced by the verdant nature amid which its solid walls are set. Yet the green of the mountains does not invade the site, but thanks to the versatility of the place forms yet another part of it. A part that makes the Agorregi complex a fairytale setting.

datosGenerales.descripcion: The museum exhibits works related to the religious art of Bizkaia. The building is the former Encarnación Convent that was founded by Dominican Sisters in 1513. The museum was open to the public in 1995 and accommodates hundreds of exhibits that date from the Middle Ages to present day. The pieces reflect their artistic and liturgical value. There is a room related to contemporary religious art. The second floor is devoted to religious expressions throughout history and styles, above all, to sculptures and paintings. The Diocesan Museum of Sacred Art houses a collection of more than 2,000 pieces, almost 500 of which are on exhibition. The collection spans the period between the 12th and 20th centuries, and also contains some archaeological items which date back as far as the 3rd century. The exhibition is divided into three broad sections: sculptures/paintings, silverware and sacred garments. In each one of these sections, the pieces are arranged in chronological and stylistic order.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Machine Tool Museum tries to pay a tribute to those who made possible the development of the sector and aims at explaining the keys of the machine tool industry, one of the bases of the region's development.

 

In order to portray the history and the present time of the machine tool industry, the building recreates an industrial workshop of the 20th century with more than 60 pieces of machinery. Of these one must highlight the first universal milling machines, as well as horizontal lathes, filing machines or sensitive drills.

 

There is an exhibition hall that gathers over 250 photographs, medieval machinery and display cabinets with various tools and devices, as well as a machinery workshop and a forge mill.

 

Restoration service of old machines and rooms for rent.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Those who visit the museum, located in the centre of Old Town of Bilbao, will be able to admire the floats of the Holy Week processions of Bilbao. Besides, each brotherhood has a stand where its most representative and significant elements are exhibited.

 

The Holy Week of Bilbao is especially characteristic because it includes some unique characters in the floats: Kakanarru de Anatxu in "The Crowning with Thorns", who is making fun of Jesus Christ; or rude Frakagorri in "Jesus Carrying the Cross", where he is playing the horn.

 

This artistic heritage can be seen throughout the year at Holy Week Procession Floats Museum and also during the Holy Week processions. Polychrome carvings by important sculptors of the Basque religious image making such as Higinio Basterra, José María Garros, Juan de Guraya, Ricardo Iñurria, Juan Larrea or Quintín de Torre, as well as others by artists from different Spanish regions.

 

Permanent exhibitions: Floats: Little Donkey; The Last Supper; Praying in the Garden; The Arrest of Jesus; Jesus before Annas; Whipping Jesus; The Crowning with Thorns; Ecce Homo; Jesus Carrying the Cross; Encounter with Mary; Three Crosses; Jesus taken Down from the Cross and Lying Christ.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The museum goes over the history of bullfighting in Bilbao and Bizkaia. It is organised as an educational unit divided into eight periods. The texts are illustrated with more than one hundred photos, prints by Goya and paintings by Bringas Brothers.

 

Besides, the museum exhibits mounted heads of renowned bulls; bullfighting suits that belonged to Antonio Ordoñez, "Niño de la Capea" and picador Egaña; a sword of "Cocherito"; a cape belonging to "Costillares"; books and scale models of Bilbao's old bullrings.

datosGenerales.descripcion: The Assembly House of Gernika is one of the most representative symbols of the Basque people. Next to the building we find the Tree of Gernika, where assemblies of the representatives of the Bizkaia's parishes were held in the old days. These meetings were called general Assemblies of Bizkaia and lasted until 1876, when the "Fueros" were abolished (the local laws by which Bizkaia was governed). Several edifices had been constructed around the oak tree until 1826, when the current Assembly House was build. After being suspended for 102 years, the assemblies were reinstated. Today, the building serves as the headquarters of the Provincial Council, which is the main institutional body in Bizkaia. The guided tour takes in the Tree of Gernika, the hall where the Assemblies, take place, and an adjoining hall which houses various artworks and objects of historical significance, such as the little hollow silver balls which were used for voting in the Assemblies (17th century), the staffs of office of the Deputies General (18th century), silver writing materials (18th century) and the cross mark that can be seen on the oaths taken by the Government of the Lordship of Bizkaia. The guitar which belonged to Joxe Mari Iparragirre is also on display. Iparragirre composed the Basque song "Gernikako arbola", in homage to the tree of Gernika.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Montefuerte or Alegría Palace, which accommodates the Gernika Museum of the Basque Country, is located in the monumental centre of Gernika and surrounded by the Assembly House, Los Pueblos de Europa Park and the Convent of Santa Clara.

The museum collects different aspects of the origin and the physical, political and economic environment of the Basques, as well as the archaeology, language and culture. The exhibit covers a period of 150,000 years.

The museum also goes over the most well-known figures in the history of the Basque Country. The collection consists of drawings, engravings, oil paintings, scale models, cartography and navigational instruments.

The museum is accommodated in the 15th century towerhouse of Ercilla, declared a national monument.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Located on the former site of the outbuildings of the Euskalduna shipyard, the goal of this museum is to inform visitors about the heritage created by maritime activities at the Bilbao Estuary, and about the maritime world in general.

 

The outside area, which extends over 20,000 square metres, houses the old dock area of the Euskalduna shipyard. It provides shelter to vessels, the "Casa de Bombas" pump-house and the unique Carola shipbuilding crane.

 

Inside the museum, meanwhile, the exhibition revolves around three key themes: "The Estuary: a seaport", "The Estuary: a market and factory" and "The Estuary: a shipyard". The museum houses a variety of restored vessels, as well as the latest technological advances, such as simulators, and sets off on a journey through Bilbao's maritime history.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Museum of Orozko provides visitors with a wide range of information about the resources of the town and of Gorbeia Natural Park through its permanent exhibition. It functions as a tourist information centre, which offers a complete service including organised trips in the area.

 

Located in the 18th century Legorburu Palace, the museum focuses on three main topics: Heritage of Orozko Valley, Traditional Way of Life in the Valley and Settlers of the High Lands of the Gorbeia.

 

Free entrance.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
This museum centres on the study and spreading of the history of the mining in the Basque Country, and especially in the Mining Area of Bizkaia. There, we will have the chance of seeing part of one of the best collections of the Spanish State on mining tools and materials, such as dump cars, stretchers, hammers, etc.

In the surroundings we will find the Concha II mine, which was once Europe's biggest iron mine, which boasts a 50-kilometre gallery. Besides, the museum gives details of the characteristics and the location of the industrial remains spread all over the Mining Area. The exhibition includes pieces, tools, machinery and documents of the former iron mines. Remarkable collection of dump cars for transporting mineral, several trestles for bucket lines, washing trommels and other samples of mining machinery used formerly in Bizkaia. The exhibition also gathers everyday items such as lamps, "choclos" (typical footwear), theodolites, drills, drilling spoons, abaci to count wagons, masks, etc., as well as paintings of the mines by well-known artists.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
What is peace? What is the legacy of the bombing of Gernika?

The bombing narrated by the people who lived it. And what about Human Rights in the world today?

Taking the previous questions as a point of reference, the Peace Museum targets at creating an attractive and dynamic area that does not expect to impose absolute truths, but invites visitors to ask themselves and talk about peace. The motto of the museum states that "It is a museum to remember, a museum for the future".

Collections: Texts, exhibition panels, objects, audiovisuals (including a sham of Gernika's bombardment) and a copy of Picasso's painting "Guernica" that provides information on peace.

Visits are allowed. There are also several buildings, such as the Palace House where the foundry men lived that now houses the museum reception and an exhibition on mills.

Located in the Old Town of Plentzia in a 16th century building (former Town Hall), Plasentia de Butrón Foundation seeks to recover and exhibit different elements of the history of Plentzia, which is closely related to the sea.

 

Visitors can admire navigational instruments, scale models of vessels, cartography, paintings of vessels from different periods, documents from the Historical Archive of Plentzia and a series of nautical objects.

datosGenerales.nombre: Basque Museum of the History of Medicine and Science
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Basque Museum of the History of Medicine and Science began its activity in 1974 at Bilbao's Academy of Medical Sciences, when objects contributed by some doctors and academicians were collected.

It is conceived as a Museum of Medicine History, but also as a Museum of Technology and Natural Science.

The museum boasts different rooms according to specific subjects related to the varied branches of medicine and to the most important Basque doctors: Caro Baroja, Monreal, etc. The museum's collection is currently made up of almost 8,000 catalogued apparatuses and instruments and some 7,000 books.

It covers a surface area of 1,520 square metres and is divided into 23 halls which exhibit materials related to the practice and study of a wide range of medical specialisations such as cardiology, ophthalmology and radiology. Other attractions include an old operating theatre, office and laboratory. , Popular Medicine and exhibitions on several medicine specialities.

datosGenerales.nombre: Las Encartaciones museum (former Casa de Juntas of Abellaneda)
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Las Encartaciones museum is located in the former Casa de Juntas or Assembly House of Abellaneda.

Opened as a museum in 1934, it took its current name and form after refurbishment in 1994, becoming a modern museum with ten rooms showing the development of the county of Las Encartaciones from prehistory to the mid-19th century.

Since then it has been devoted to studying the history, ethnography, art and heritage of Las Encartaciones, through research, exhibitions, publications, cultural events, educational activities, cultural routes, acquiring heritage and so on.

The Casa de Juntas of Abellaneda was the place where representatives of the councils and valleys of Las Encartaciones met up to the early 19th century. The first mention of these assemblies dates from 1394, but the current building was started in the 16th century.

The Casa de Juntas evolved over the years, especially in the 18th century, when the house of the Teniente Corregidor or Lieutenant Magistrate (now the museum offices) and the Posada de los Junteros or accommodation for the representatives (now a restaurant) were built, the latter on the site of an early chapel.

In 1801 the assemblies stopped meeting and the building began to decline, until a first rebuilding in 1901 and a second in 1931. Finally, between 1942 and 1957, it took on its current appearance, when an extra floor, battlements, numerous windows and a spiral staircase inside were added. In 1994 the building was again rebuilt inside to house a modern museum, with a spacious new extension added at the front for a reception area and the temporary activity spaces.

This Casa de Juntas is, together with those of Gernika and Gerediaga, the property and official seat of the Bizkaia provincial authority, known as the oldest parliament in Europe and symbolising the continuity of Basque traditions.

Free entrance.

datosGenerales.nombre: Parque de los Pueblos de Europa
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Parque de los Pueblos de Europa was inaugurated in 1991.

It is a beautiful and quiet spot that is found to be perfect to enjoy nature in pure condition. The park is situated in Gernika-Lumo, next to the emblematic Assembly House of Bizkaia.

This park displays two well-known sculptures: Gure Aitaren Etxea-Our Father's House by Donostia-San Sebastián artist Eduardo Chillida and Large Figure in a Shelter by the English artist Henry Moore. Moreover, the visitors will have the chance to contemplate Humboldt bust. 

It is also remarkable the wide range of trees and bushes -including beechtrees, old oaks and holm oaks- and the beautiful pond present in the park.

datosGenerales.descripcion: The "Tower of Zarautz", the oldest building in the town (fourteenth century), accommodates the Art and History Museum, which together with the Santa María la Real's Parochial Church made up the historical and archaeological monuments of Zarautz. Through the museum we can become acquainted with part of the history of the Basque coast. Protected by the walls of the museum, archaeological remains have been discovered, such as a necropolis of the first settlers of Zarautz. Taking it a starting point, the museum offers a chronological tour through the history that ends with an exhibition of contemporary paintings and sculptures.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Ethnographic Museum tries to be an exponent of the evolution of Zerain's lifestyle. Different sections exhibit utensils, furniture, tools, handicrafts, etc. that reflect the town's history.

 

Visitors can admire more than 200 items that give evidence of the survival process that has undergone Zerain throughout history, from the time the residents were devoted to agriculture and shepherding, going through the mining period to the present day. 

 

The museum dates from 1993 and is the result of the voluntary effort of a group of youths helped by an ethnologist. 

 

Collections: More than 200 objects donated by the residents of Zerain. 

 

Permanent exhibitions: The collection is divided in 12 sections where exhibits are grouped into specific themes: games, agricultural implements, pottery, home, etc. Back projection.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Museum Sagardoetxea consists of three different spaces: the museum, the apple orchard and the centre for tasting.

The museum is full of photographs, information boards, games, interactive screens, as well as materials linked with the newest technologies to display. The apple orchard consists of 8 different areas where several types of apple trees, growing and grafts will be shown.

Finally, in the third area visitors will taste the cider and particularly receive an introductory course to the "txotx", the practice of opening barrels. Products of the 13 cider cellars making up the Sagardun consortium will be tasted. In the centre for tasting easy ground analyses are made, as well as the ripening process of the apples and other activities in which visitors can take part. 

When the weather does not allow walking along the exteriors of the museum, the centre can be visited. Exhibitions: Through interactive material, photos and games, the Sagardoetxea Museum shows the history, past, present and future of the amazing world of the apple and its relevance in the Basque Country. The museum belongs to the Basque network of food and drink museums.

datosGenerales.nombre: Basque Museum. Basque Ethnographic and Historical Museum
datosGenerales.descripcion:
TEMPORARILY CLOSED

The Basque Museum depicts the Basque ethnography making use of varied items and objects. The museum is located in the Old Town of Bilbao in a building that used to accommodate the former Jesuit School of San Andrés (1604) and the former Mercy House. The valuable edifice and its cloister guard significant treasures, starting from the oldest traces of Biscay to the evidence of the traditional lifestyles of the Basque people. The collection is divided into different rooms devoted to prehistory, the sea and fishing, shepherding culture, the ironworks and gunsmith industry, commercial activity, and the traditional trades and craftsmanships such as pottery and fabric making. An amazing scale model of Bizkaia completes the exhibition. Visitors will encounter popular and worship pieces of furniture spread all over the museum.

datosGenerales.nombre: Museum of Art and History of Durango
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Museum of Art and History of Durango is located in the Etxezarreta Palace, a construction built in the 18th century by José Joaquín de Echezarreta.

The museum is divided into two areas: the area of history, which gathers portraits of historical figures of Durango and documents and cartography of the town and Bizkaia; and the area of art, which accommodates a selection of modern and contemporary Basque paintings.

The museum aims at preserving and spreading any kind of cultural activity that has taken place in Durango throughout the history and at present time, as well as collecting references and works from abroad related to Durango. The building also houses the Crime History Centre.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Featuring diverse artworks from an extensive chronological period, the collection at Bilbao Fine Arts Museum currently contains 8,000 works, including paintings, sculptures, drawings, engravings and decorative arts, dating from the 12th century to the present day.

Ancient, modern and contemporary art, paintings from the Spanish and Flemish schools and pieces by Basque artists are all present in the collection.

Of particular prominence are works by Adolfo Guiard, Ambrosius Benson, Anton Van Dyck, Antoni Tàpies, Antonio Moro, Aurelio Arteta, Bartolomé Bermejo, Chilliza, Oteiza, El Greco, Zuloaga, Sorolla, Goya, Francis Bacon and Bartolomé Esteban Murillo, among many others.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Simón Bolívar Museum is home to several collections that depict the lifestyle of Bizkaia's people in the Middle Ages and the life and political career of Simón Bolívar, the "Liberator" of several American countries.

 

The museum was inaugurated on July 24th 1983, coinciding with the bicentenary of his birth. Located in Ziortza-Bolibar, hometown of the forebears of the revolutionary leader, the town was previously known as La puebla de Bolibar when it belonged to the nearby Markina-Xemein. The Errementarikua farmhouse accommodates the museum next to the Saint James' Way.

 

The museum exhibits Bolivian iconography in the hall, while the first floor makes a tour through the Middle Ages: medieval lifestyle and landscape, the church in the Middle Ages, economic activities, ironworks and the foundation of the town. The second floor is entirely devoted to Simón Bolívar: his biography, genealogy, his trips to Europe, geography of the independence of the "Bolivarian" countries and other objects.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Honey Museum (Murguia), which is located in the middle of the Old Town, introduces visitors to the extraordinary world of beekeeping.

 

The museum is situated within the Oregi House and shows the techniques to produce honey in the area of Gorbeia, as well as many instruments and elements traditionally used when handling beehives and making honey and its derivatives. This very floor consists of a room where beekeepers will extract and bottle honey.

 

On the second floor slides will be showed, where the fascinating world of bees will be screened, as well as their behaviour and their working hierarchy. Free entrance.

datosGenerales.nombre: Restoration works of the Cathedral of Santa María
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Saint Mary’s cathedral, known as the Catedral Vieja or Old Cathedral, is one of the treasures of Vitoria-Gasteiz.

 

It stands in the heart of the city’s almond-shaped Mediaeval quarter, and attracts thousands of tourists every year. Discover this Gothic cathedral for yourself with a guided tour lasting an hour.

 

Tours must be arranged in advance by telephoning the visitor centre on 945 255 135, sending an email to visitas@catedralvitoria.eus or via the website of the Fundación Catedral Santa María(http://www.catedralvitoria.eus. Tours are available in Spanish, Basque, French, English, German and Italian.

 

As a curiosity it should be noted that the well-known British writer, Ken Follet, was inspired by the Cathedral when it came to writing World Without End, which is the sequel to The Pillars of the Earth, his most popular work. Guided tours: Tours by previous appointment. Call Visitor Reception Centre, send an e-mail or enter The Cathedral of Santa María Foundation website.

Cathedral + walls: 10 €

datosGenerales.nombre: Ancient and classic cars museum (Loizaga Tower)
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Concejuelo castle is a majestic fortress located in the town of Galdames, in Bizkaia. In its interior the visitors will have the chance to admire a magnificent collection of classic and ancient cars, which is considered to be unique in the world as all the Rolls-Royce makes can be found in the castle.

 

The castle was built in the Middle Ages during the wars between clans. The current castle was rebuilt in 1985 and consists of a tower -Loizaga Tower- of 25 metres surrounded by large rooms, a moat with a drawbridge and walls. Within the walls of the castle, the visitors will have the possibility to get to know the history o automobiles.

 

The exhibition is divided into six large rooms and three of them focus on Rolls-Royce make. In all, there are 75 cars in perfect condition: from the first production car ("Ford T") to classic sports automobiles (Ferrari Testarrosa, Lamborghini Countach...) and cars from the 30's (Hispano-suiza, Isotta, Bentley...). But, for sure, the gem of the museum is the valuable Rolls-Royce collection, which brings together 45 models of the luxurious British make.

 

There, the most ancient models are remarkable: 1910 "Silver Ghost", some cars that date back between the 20's and 60's, such as "Phantom", and different makes such as "Silver Wraith" and "Spur", which were designed between the 80's and the 90's.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
La Encartada Fabrika Museoa is located on the outskirts of Balmaseda, on the shore of Cadagua river.

 

The site intends to spread the valuable industrial legacy of the textile factory. A plant involved in the production of woollen knitwear -berets mainly- since its foundation back in 1892 to its closure in 1992. With the double aim of preserving the historic textile heritage and create a leisure and tourism centre the regional council of Bizkaia and Balmaseda Town Council took on the responsibility for recovering the factory for museum ends.

 

The site consists of several buildings: the factory-museum, the houses to accommodate workers, a chapel that served as a school, and so on. With the opening of the first two floors of the restored factory-museum the project's main stage will be concluded: the coffee bar and the leisure area. In a second stage the museum will focus on implementing improvement works on old houses as well as the chapel.

 

The architectural richness adds to a machinery complex of great value: a water turbine from the beginning of the 20th century, a complex mechanism of belts and pulleys that activates the production mechanisms. Guided tours show other areas such as the former wool drying shed, spinning section, areas for beret production and section of cloths.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The first Basque Country Liqueur Museum examines the history of the Manuel Acha distillery, which is an emblematic firm settled in Amurrio since its creation in 1831.

The museum is located on the distillery's first floor and divided into three spaces. The area analyses all sorts of liqueur manufacture and provides eminent brands such as Karpy, which consists of a meticulous selection of sweet and bitter oranges and Pacharán Atxa, made of blackthorns picked up in Orduña Mountains.

This way, the museum displays from the very first barrels and utensils used to drip aguardiente (alcoholic beverage) and liqueurs to accounts and advertising material from the beginning of the 20th century. There are also available references about Karpy; a cycling team from the 60-70s. Jerseys and caps of those times are on display.

datosArteCultura.horario: Due to the current situation due to COVID19, visits to the Acha Museum are canceled.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The town of Portugalete, located at the banks of the Ria, is home to the Rialia Industrial Museum.

The Rialia Industrial Museum holds a permanent exhibition based on the historic-artistic background of Biscay High Furnaces.

Rialia Industrial Museum devotes its last room to housing seasonal exhibitions, showcasing pieces by artists who take their inspiration in the "iron region", as well as exhibitions with industrial, seafaring, and nautical themes... Five years after its inauguration in January 2006, Rialia Industrial Museum modifies its permanent exhibition.

It is an impressive collection of art pieces which once adorned this corporation¿s headquarters. Its nucleus is formed by a pictorial collection with an industrial theme, the majority of which were painted in watercolours, and which date back to the mid-20th century.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Shepherding ecomuseum is located within a 16th century farmhouse that enables getting to know shepherding activity and Idiazabal cheese making in its environment.

 

By means of an audiovisual screening the Ecomuseum relives the landscape humanised by shepherds and the cattle management according to the seasons. Moreover, the permanent exhibition presents a tour across the area, the cattle transhumance, sheep pens, shepherds' huts, latxa sheep, sheep life cycle, shepherding and artisan, traditional and current process of cheese making. Visits including the participation in the cheese-making process are permitted by appointment.

 

On September's first Sunday it is held the Shepherd Day (Artzain Eguna). We will find sheepdogs championship, contests, cheese tasting and artisan exhibits related to shepherding.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Bread Corner (El Rincón del Pan) is situated within the Igaralde-Goena Farmhouse in the neighbourhood of Brinkola, Legazpi.

 

The museum exhibits the characteristics of milling and bread making tradition in the region of Urola. It aims to become a tribute to the miller figure and bread intake, which is a constant feature of our history.

 

Therefore, the Bread Corner explains different processes that go from sowing grain to the very instant in which the bread is taken out of the oven. Farming implements, mills grinding grain, the oven to bake bread and many other utensils are present in the place.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Basque Iron Museum is situated in Legazpi, within an ancient foundry of the same name. It focuses on iron from the point of view of technology, history, science, heritage, industry, landscape, and so on. Furthermore, the centre displays original elements of the old pavilion of "Fundiciones San Miguel", where the museum is located. It reuses those materials and gives them new functions in accordance with the new applications.

 

The connection between the human being, the environment and iron making is the starting point of the following routes: "El latido de las ferrerías" and "Un viaje a los años 50: la Ruta Obrera". The museum consists of 14 areas where iron is tacked from different points of view: influence on landscape, in art and mythology, mineral extraction, energy, foundries, its transformation into steel, socio-economic organisation, forging and smelting, technological innovations, and so on.

datosArteCultura.horario: Given the current situation it will remain CLOSED, anyway, it can be visited by appointment. (943 73 04 28)

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Apart from being one of the oldest houses in these surroundings, Ardixarra is one of the most emblematic buildings of Segura. It's construction dates back to the end of the 16th century. Earlier it was a workshop-house that a craftwork master or a trader ordered to build.

 

This is a good example of what houses of Segura looked like shortly after the Middle Ages and one of the few urban wooden houses that are still standing. Three floors make up the building. The ground floor houses the tourist office and an audiovisual production related to Segura's history and culture. The materials used in those times constructions are on display on the first floor. Many other exhibitions also take place here.

 

On the second floor the visitors will find the Medieval Interpretation Centre, which is the first of this kind in the Basque Country. The area is divided into three sections that review our culture in and easy and entertaining way. The History unit explains visitors the process carried out to establish a town (including Gipuzkoa towns), as well as maps, many documents, information about the Way of St.

 

Jamesý As for the section known as Urbanism, we will find information in detail about Segura's urban morphology in the 15th and 16th centuries, the walls and plot division. The last section provides information about the social groups, fight between families, guilds and brotherhoods, as well as conflicts due to private and public areas. Moreover, the centre organises tours to the Old Town and church. Tickets Normal: 2 Euro Discount of 25% for groups of over 10 people. Free entrance for children up to 6 years old.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Oiasso Roman Museum in Irun is an archaeological centre that brings together the Roman remains found by the Arkeolan society around the primitive city of Oiasso, which extends over an area of some 12-15 hectares.

It is also a space for cultural activities related to ancient history and archaeology.

The Museum offers the opportunity to learn about the archaeological findings of the public baths of Oiasso, its port and life in the city during the 1st and 2nd centuries AD in an entertaining way. All of this through different areas that focus on the impact of the Roman world on local society.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
ARENATZarte represents harmony between a natural setting that is both diverse and exotic, contemporary works of art and an architecture that recalls days gone by.

 

Three things that not only complement one another, but coexist completely naturally.

 

The ARENATZarte botanical garden, in Güeñes, is home to 1.5 hectares of contemporary art blended into the most varied of natural settings. The place dates back to the early 19th century when its first owner, Mr. Leandro Urrutia, who had made his fortune in Mexico, brought back exotic trees from the Americas - which still survive today at ARENATZarte. The house, with its French and Art Nouveau-influenced design, is today the town hall responsible for the village and its surrounding area, while the trees originally imported continue to rise majestically over the gardens, up to a hundred years old. But what make ARENATZarte an oasis for reflection and contemplation are the sculptures that emerge from the ground like the trees themselves, merging with the rest of the garden.

 

These works, created by Koldobika Jauregi, the Roscubas brothers, Ángel Garraza and Mikel Lertxundil, represent a veritable ode to nature for visitors to interact with. The garden, the town hall and the glass house all host exhibitions, talks and workshops. In short, an easily accessible place that is there not only to be admired, but also touched, making a visit into a pleasure for all the senses.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Sensitising and making the visitor aware of the importance of preserving our natural resources are the main targets of The Aizkorri-Aratz Park House.

 

In this sense, it offers comprehensive information about nature and the life in the municipality, as well as about the preservation of ecosystems. Our guide to the centre is an edible dormouse or "mitxarro", as it is known in the Basque Country. This small mammal rodent is currently in danger of extinction, and therefore, plays an important role in the centre.

 

Visitors will discover inside exhibitions on the machinery used in ironworks during the 18th century and on the water as energy source. Furthermore, the centre keeps also a reproduction of an ancient kitchen. Nature is very important for the new interpretation centre.

 

Whereas the fauna section focuses on the "mitxarro", the flora section deals with vegetable specimens from the Natural Park of Aizkorri-Aratz. The centre puts at visitors' disposal different information systems such as panels, photographs, diaporamas and many interactive games that enable us to learn in a creative manner.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Water is tightly bounded up with Sobrón's history. The town, which is located by the bank of the river Ebro, lived glorious times back in the 19th century up to halfway through the 20th century for its former spa made use of water that contained mineral concentration. The creation of the museum is a way to honour an important part of the town's history.

 

The Museum of Water provides an unusual route that will make the visitors reflect on the importance of water. The interactive area combines new technologies with audiovisual aids that enable enjoying and acquiring knowledge at the same time.

 

The exhibition is grouped according to subject: "Lively water" -shows different states of water by means of visual and hearing aids-, "Water Science" -displays the connection between water and life-, "Healing water" -provides information about the therapeutic properties of water and connection with magic, superstitions and religions-, "Water and environment" -that gives advice on how to save water- and "Thinking water" -that is a human head of large size that displays the importance of water to the body.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The historic building known as Torre Madariaga, built in the 15th century in Busturia and situated in a setting of extraordinary beauty like Urdaibai Biosphere Reserve, plays host to the Ekoetxea Urdaibai Euskadi Biodiversity Centre.

The association has two purposes: to become both a framework for biodiversity and a worldwide benchmark for natural heritage. 

The building consists of two sections. One of the rooms centres on research and understanding biodiversity -which is known as Knowledge Unit-, whereas the other section -known as Area of Public participation- will raise public awareness and encourage diffusion among the public by means of offering information about biological diversity dynamically and raising awareness above all. The place makes use of exhibitions ¿the permanent one deals with the meaning of biodiversity-, audiovisual aids, interactive systems, and so on.

Once finished with this section, the visitors will have the chance to access the balcony of Tower Madariaga and enjoy the magnificent views. By means of spyglasses they will make out Izaro Island, Laida beach and Urdaibai's wetlands. Obviously, to complete the tour it is also possible to take part in the guided tours around the Urdaibai Biosphere Reserve.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
TOPIC, Tolosa's International Puppet Centre, radiates magic to the core, where imagination, innovation and originality go hand in hand. This is the only centre in Europe focusing exclusively on the puppet's world. In fact, we should not forget that Tolosa has always had a very tight connection with this art, as the Titirijai Puppet Festival proves.

 

The ground floor plays host to the modern auditorium with a capacity of 250 spectators, and staging and rehearsal rooms, whereas the first floor has a cafeteria and a buffet restaurant to hold performances or exhibitions of intimate atmosphere. On that very floor can be found the puppet storeroom, which keeps the pieces that are not on display.

 

As to the second floor, the permanent and temporary exhibitions take place in here. It should also be noted that the wide TOPIC collection consists of over 2.500 puppets from 40 countries.

 

To finish, the archives, the documentation centre (DVDs, books, posters, photos'), artists' and researchers' headquarters and rooms for workshops are situated on the third floor, whereas the fourth holds choir rehearsals.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Eibar is home to a museum devoted to the preservation and exhibition of the historical memory and the industrial heritage of a town traditionally linked to the arms industry. This is a good way to recognise the job carried out by the artisans over the past centuries.

 

The museum provides a historical route throughout the evolution of the industry from the 14th century to these days, showing how as a result of the sector's crisis in the 1920s Eibar passed from being a completely arms production to a large production diversification. The museum houses among its pieces a large group of arms belonging to several collections such as the Armoury School Museum, and a wide range of local products such as bicycles, motorcycles, household appliances, office material...

 

Apart from reflecting a broad production variety that has led to the development of the industry, they also show international importance. The visitors begin the tour with an audio-visual display recounting the 600-year history of gun-making in the area.

 

Second, they will move on to the exhibition facilities, divided up into two section: the first features exclussively an arms' collection and the evolution of small arms. As to the second area, it displays the history of Eibar by means of its industrial evolution. Facts that have been and still are the driving force of economy.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Santa Catalina Lighthouse Interpretation Centre, which is dedicated to navigation, gives us the opportunity to place ourselves in the shoes of sailors who, lost at sea, finally see the beam of the lighthouse, which guides them home safely.

 

Thanks to the technological resources available at the Santa Catalina Lighthouse, visitors will be able to learn the basic principles of navigation, which take their roots in ancient times. They'll be able to put their newly-acquired knowledge into practice by taking a virtual boat trip from Elantxobe to Lekeitio.

This is the first lighthouse in Euskadi that can be visited.
