datosGenerales.descripcion:
Nestled on the hillside that bears its name, the Fort of San Marcos is one of the most emblematic places in Errenteria. As well as being a splendid vantage point from where we can marvel at the spectacular views of the town, it's worth noting that its pillars are home to a long history. It was built in 1888 with the purpose of protecting San Sebastián from the attacks of the French troops, both on land and sea. Later, after the Civil War, the fort served as a prison.

 

Since 1970, the Army used it to carry our maneuvers, until in 1992 it was acquired by Errenteria Town Council. One year later, work began on restoration. Currently, as well as being a vantage point par excellence in Oarsoaldea, a museum has also been set up where military activity has been recreated and several replicas have been housed there: machine guns, cannons, soldiers, artillery, etc.

 

In addition to all the above, there are two information points known as Cicerone. Using this system involves dialling a telephone number and we will be provided with all the information about the place we are visiting. Once you make the call, the relevant tourist office will send the calendar of events scheduled for that day to the user's mobile phone. Also, at the entrance to the fort three is a hall which has been fitted out to accommodate the reception area and San Marko Tourist Information Point, as well as a scale model so visitors can get an overview of the Oarsoaldea Region.

 

Guided tours are also offered during high season. On 25th April the feast of San Marcos is celebrated and holds a very special meaning for the inhabitants of the Oarsoaldea region and towns such as Irun.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
AZKUNA Zentroa is located right in the heart of the Biscayan capital and is one of the most representative buildings in the town.

 

The old wine warehouse, designed in 1909 by Ricardo Bastida, is now a spectacular multi-purpose civic centre dedicated to leisure and culture, the transformation of which has been carried out by the renowned Philippe Starck.

 

Azkuna Zentroa is an innovative, multidisciplinary, dynamic venue, a place which opens the way for knowledge, cultural representations of various kinds, physical fitness and fun. Amongst the features that attract most attention on the inside of the building are the forty-three columns designed by Starck and made under the supervision of the Italian stage designer Lorenzo Baraldi.

 

Azkuna Zentroa has a media library, a fitness centre, a swimming pool, an exhibition hall, an auditorium, movie theatres, a multi-purpose hall, restaurants, cafeterias and a shop. A range of events are held at the centre, such as the Gutun Zuria literary festival.

datosGenerales.descripcion: The museum will be closed from 2 to 25 May, day on which the collection will be renewed. The Cristóbal Balenciaga Museoa is dedicated to the illustrious designer from Getaria, considered a genius of international haute couture. Located in Parque Aldamar, the museum consists of two buildings: the Aldamar Palace and a new annexed building. The former, built in the 19th century, houses temporary exhibitions and the Documentation Centre. Otherwise, the new building boasts three large areas: the first contains six exhibition galleries, a visitor reception area, a shop, cafeteria and a multi-purpose room. The second space is given over to didactic activities, whilst the third houses a restoration workshop and facilities for the internal management of the centre. The Cristóbal Balenciaga Foundation boasts a collection of 1,200 pieces, which will be exhibited in rotational fashion. At present, the permanent exhibition is made up of 70 pieces, including dresses and accessories, divided amongst the six thematic areas: Early Years, Day, Cocktail, Evening, Brides and Essential Balenciaga. The exhibit hopes to showcase the best of the designer's work. Entry Fee Normal: 10 euros. Special: groups and large families, 10% discount. Reduced: 7 euros (pensioners, students, Gazte Txartela holders and young people up to the age of 18 years old) Free: ICOM members, Basque public school teachers and children under 9 years old.

datosGenerales.nombre: Ataria. Interpretation Centre of the Salburua wetlands
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Ataria is the Interpretation Centre of the Salburua wetlands. The goal of this centre is to favour knowledge of the wetlands and show their natural values and, therefore, the importance of the biodiversity and natural heritage of Vitoria-Gasteiz.

 

It occupies an emblematic building that is perfectly integrated into its surroundings, located to the north of Salburua Park.

 

This is a space that is open to the public which, supported by a large number of resources and services - exhibition space, classrooms, observatory - , houses all types of activities: leisure and entertainment, interpretation, popularisation and communication, studies and research into biodiversity.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Nautilus, the Mutriku Geological Interpretation Centre was founded in order to study and explore the roots of Mutriku, a town located in the province of Gipuzkoa.

 

The key to unlocking this information is to be found in Mutriku's rocks, which unveil secrets that have been hidden for millions of years. An audiovisual presentation in Spanish and Basque explains to us, step by step, Mutriku's geological history, starting from 120 million years ago and taking us right up to the present day. In addition, brightly coloured displays allow us to peer into the fauna and flora of the era.

 

All of the fossils which are exhibited in Nautilus come from the collection of Jesús M. Narváez Amasorrain and have been gathered in Mutriku over a period of 30 years. Similarly, at Nautilus we can find some of the most representative fossil specimens of the Mesozoic Era: the ammonites. It is a thrilling journey in time which will transport us to the dinosaur era.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
TEMPORARILY CLOSED

The Way of St James Interpretation Centre, in Orio, offers detailed information on the entire Way of St James. The building is divided into three floors.

 

The ground floor holds the information office and tourist office. On the first floor you can find an explanation of the history and current status of the Way, the pilgrimage, art and legends surrounding the Way; while on the second floor you can discover the Coastal Way and the Inland Way as they pass through the Basque Country.

 

The centre has interactive modules in several languages, audiovisual projections and educational material.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The history of Zerain is closely linked to iron and to understand its present it is essential to find out about its mining past.

 

Aizpitta visitor centre explains the whole process of extracting iron in a fun, educational way, as well as the impact this has had on the landscape today, the local economy, society and culture. Aizpitta visitor centre is at the heart of the Montaña del Hierro - the “Iron Mountain”, a place listed as a Monumental Site - and the starting point to discover the spectacular mines of Aizpea, which are one of the main attractions in Zerain.

 

Special mention must be made of the restored "Polborina" gallery, which is open to visitors.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The town of Zegama is the entry point to the Parque Natural de Aizkorri-Aratz natural park, and is home to one of the park's interpretation centres. This centre, located in the Anduetza country house, studies the close relationship Zegama has maintained with the natural park throughout history.

 

The visitor will be able to discover the cultural and natural phenomena which go hand in hand in this environment, as well as receive information about tours and tourist attractions in the area. Various products from Zegama are sold, such as cheese, walnut cookies, ceramic pieces, honey, and carved wooden pieces.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Izenaduba is a magical forest! Olentzero (one of the jentilaks or giants in Basque mythology), the galtzagorris (a type of imp otherwise known as Red Pants), Mari (a goddess), the lamiak (creatures with bird-like feet), Basajaun (Lord of the forest), Tartalo (a one-eyed giant)...

 

Our main aim is for children to learn about mythology, nature and Basque traditions in a fun way, through these characters and the visit to the park, while at the same time being educational. Izenaduba Basoa is the first mythological theme park in the Basque Country. We want to give children the opportunity to have an unforgettable day, while learning at the same time.

 

This is why we designed Izenaduba Basoa, to be a magical place brimful with possibilities. The Olentzero's Baserri: In the Olentzero's magical home children will learn about mythology and nature in a magical setting by playing interactive games and using new technologies. Guided tours: Guided tours for groups of 30-35 people maximum. Information in both Basque and Spanish.

 

Audio guides also available in both languages. Tours for groups and school groups from Monday to Friday. Tours for all the public at the weekend, bank holiday and school holiday. *3D Simulator: This is a unique opportunity for adults and children to enjoy a 3D experience. Outdoor themed attractions: 6000 square metres of themed attractions (Mari¿s cave, the Labyrinth, Tartalo and the Sacred Oak...) for children to steep themselves in our mythology while at play. There is a Tourist Information Point at Reception in the centre.

datosGenerales.nombre: Basque Interpretation Centre for Historical Memory
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Basque Interpretation Centre for Historical Memory, in Elgeta, focuses on the Spanish Civil War.

 

As well as treating military issues, the centre investigates the causes and consequences of the war, based on what happened in the vicinity of Elgeta and using witness reports from the time. Dignity and memory are the backbone of the centre.

 

On one hand, visitors can see the permanent exhibitions in Espaloia Café Theatre in Elgeta, comprised of weapons, tools and newspapers from the time, models and audiovisuals.

 

On the other, they can take a thematic tour of around 5 kilometres, and discover the remains of the trenches, parapets and shelter in the foothills of mount Intxorta.

 

Guided tours the first and last Sunday of each month. For bookings call (+34) 943 71 89 11 or (+34) 943 79 64 63 or send an e-mail to turismo@debagoiena.net

datosGenerales.nombre: Albaola, The sea factory of the basques
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Albaola is an innovative space located in Pasaia, close to San Sebastian, where the Basque maritime universe is explained and where the handcrafted maritime technology is recovered and given value.

 

The core business of this Factory is the building of historical vessels. In Albaola, the Basque Maritime Factory, it is possible to know the building of a replica of the San Juan Galleon, an iconic whaleboat of the 16th century.

 

Located in Ondartxo cove, in Pasaia, , it allows knowing on site the history of the San Juan whaleboat, an example of the first transoceanic cargo vessels setting sail from Euskadi to Terranova, as well as the handcrafted works that will be performed during the next years.

 

For building its replica, the same handcrafted materials are used and the historical process of building is also respected. It is divided into three spaces: - The museum and the permanent exhibition, - The space for handcrafted work of bank carpenters and - The big wooden shed where the already worked parts of the San Juan whaleboat will be assembled.

 

As attractive and due to a work in the pedestrian access to the museum, the only way to get there will be by boat, a free service for all our visitors. All the information about the boat access will be detailed directly to the visitor when making the reservation.

BOOKING NECESSARY: bisitak@albaola.com  / (+34) 943.39.24.26
(from tuesday to friday: 10:00 - 14:00).

datosGenerales.nombre: Interpretation Centre for the Basque-Navarre Railway Line Greenway
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Interpretation Centre for the Basque-Navarre Railway Line Greenway is located in the medieval town of Antoñana located in Campezo / Kanpezu 

 

It is made up of three train carriages which replicate those belonging to what was known as "El Trenico", or "The Little Train". This train was in operation between 1927 and 1967, connecting Estella, Vitoria-Gasteiz and Bergara. Nowadays, the Basque-Navarre Railway Line Greenway recreates this route. 

 

The first carriage houses the tourist office for the Montaña Alavesa region, while the second one focuses on "El Trenico", as well as providing information about hiking and cycling routes and the Izki Natural Park. Finally, original features of the railway service are recreated in the third carriage, including tickets, pictures and uniforms from that era.

 

A bike-hiring service is available.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Santxotena Museum Workshop is located 600 metres from the centre of Artziniega. It gives visitors the chance to become acquainted with the artist Xabier Santxotena. It is an open learning space which features Santxotena's creations, from everything from sketches to completed sculptures (categorised into "families"). A disciple of Oteiza, the Navarre-born sculptor studied at the Vitoria-Gasteiz School of Arts and Crafts.

 

There will also be special children's workshops within the Museum Workshop, giving youngsters the opportunity to create sculptures of their own.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
All the visitors who want to know more about the nature that involves the Urdaibai Biosphere Reserve cannot miss the Urdaibai Bird Center.

 

Besides being a great museum and a scientific research center of birds, what makes unique the Bird Center is that the equipment itself is a privileged observatory of the marshland, located on the heart of the Urdaibai Biosphere Reserve and with amazing views.

 

It is indeed a living center, where every day brings something new, as the course of events is set by the birds. We are taking about one of the greatest phenomenon of the nature, the migration of birds where Urdaibai is a compulsory stop in this great journey.

 

The visitors will enjoy the birds that visit Urdaibai "in situ" from the observatories; Spoonbills from the Wadden Sea, elegant herons, several species of ducks, wader birds arrived from the far north and even birds so evasive as the eurasian bittern.

 

We are in front of a big airport for birds where the advice by the staff of the Center and the spectacular audiovisuals that are inside, will introduce us in this exciting world.

 

The visitor can make the self-guided visit through audio-guides in an autonomous way, or also a guided visit which requires an appointment.

datosGenerales.nombre: Añana Salt Valley Reception and Interpretation Centre
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The visit to the Añana Salt Valley begins in the Reception and Interpretation Centre. The building, which is in the shape of a capsized boat and is known as "El Torco", is located in one of the old public salt storage tanks.

 

Here, visitors will be able to book their guided tours, obtain information about the Salt Valley provided to them through audiovisual panels, find out about international salts, purchase products related to this emblematic salt valley, and learn about the work of the salt makers.

datosArteCultura.horario: Open all year round, except for 25th December and 1st January. Opening hours: check official website.

galeria.titulo: Añana Salt Valley Reception and Interpretation Centre

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Txingudi Ekoetxea Interpretation Centre is located in the Plaiaundi Ecological Park and offers information about the park itself, the bay and the natural parks which are included in the Txingudi Special Master Plan.

 

In the main room, visitors will find a model of the bay, information panels and an interactive point with a touch screen. In addition, in the audiovisual room they will be able to watch the birds in Plaiaundi through two webcams. The centre also boasts an observatory and a reading area.

 

They organise a multitude of activities, such as guided tours around the Txingudi marshes, bird-watching courses and activities for schoolchildren.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Santurtzi Historical Interpretation Centre aims to reflect the most significant historical events in this seafaring town, making use of digital screens, a virtual theatre, a model and an audiovisual presentation.

 

In addition, it boasts a periscope in the building's vantage point, which enables the visitor to see Santurtzi as it was at the beginning of the 20th century.

 

Entry fee: Free entry.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The popular Agurtza tuna-fishing boat, one of the last remaining traditional wooden fishing vessels on our coast, built in Lekeitio in 1968, has been converted into the Fishing Interpretation Centre.

Visitors can learn about how the fishermen lived at sea, the boat's distinguishing features, the history behind the Santurtzi port, the different arts of fishing, and the different types of boats that exist.

The Interpretation Centre boasts information panels and audio guides in Spanish, Basque and English.

Entry fee: 18-65 years old 2.5€; 5-17 years old, more than 65 years old and groups 1.5€

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Mater Boat Museum is the last great Basque tuna boat made of out of wood. 

Built in 1990 by the Etxegoiens, a family of fishermen, the Mater fished anchovies, mackerel, sardines and bonito for 13 years. The decision to turn it into a museum to disseminate the region´s maritime legacy was an initiative of the Itsas Gela association.

Nowadays, it is based in Pasaia and has become real living maritime heritage. It is a peculiar EcoActive Boat with two aims: raise awareness on sustainability of the traditional Basque fishing arts and teaching people how to take care of the marine environment.

Mater offers a wide-ranging programme of activities with a single goal: find out, love and conserve Pasaia-Jaizkibel-Ulia’s maritime, natural and cultural environment.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The interpretation centre situation in the Plaza de Armas of Hondarribia offers all kinds of information for visitors to this seafaring town. For example, the ground floor of the building contains information about the cultural activities and main tourist attractions of Hondarribia and the Bidasoa area.

 

The first floor is given over to a permanent exhibition devoted to the town's history and heritage, offering visitors an insight into the past, present and future of Hondarribia, and the top floor is used for a events such as book presentations, temporary exhibitions and lectures.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Debagoiena Interpretation Centre, located at the Arantzazu Sanctuary, beside the shop, offers tourist information about the Debagoiena area of the province of Gipuzkoa.

 

The centre organises all kinds of activities (active tourism, guided routes to discover the area's most emblematic places, gastronomic tours, etc.) as well as arranging tours of the sanctuary.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Leitzaran Visitor Centre comprises the Water Interpretation Centre and the Fishing School.

 

The Water Interpretation Centre, whose aim is to provide visitors with an insight into the natural and cultural merits of the Leitzaran Valley, boasts an exhibition area, video room and other facilities.

 

The Fishing School is dedicated to the art of recreational catch-and-release fishing and has its own spinning area and fishing preserve where visitors can practise this form of fishing in situ.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Chillida Lantoki is a venue where art and industry go hand in hand.

 

The museum is dedicated to sculptor Eduardo Chillida's relationship with the manufacturing sector, with a special focus on the Patricio Echeverría foundry (Legazpi) and Sidenor in Reinosa (Cantabria). Some of Chillida's best-known works were forged at these two factories.

 

The museum is housed in the old Legazpi paper mill, offering visitors a first-hand experience of the things that make a factory tick. The items on display include photographs, audiovisuals and a variety of interactive materials.

datosArteCultura.horario: Visits by appointment: 943 730 428

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Centro de Interpretación de la Pasión Viviente (The Living Passion Interpretation Centre) is located in the Santa Clara convent, which is one of Balmaseda's most symbolic monuments. The centre gives visitors the chance to learn all about the Living Way of the Cross. The spectacular reenactment attracts thousands of people every year.

 

The permanent exhibition includes clothes, Holy Week procession floats, pictures and sounds. The centre, which serves as the headquarters of the Asociación Vía Crucis Viviente de Balmaseda (Balmaseda Living Way of the Cross Association), also hosts a range of workshops.

datosContacto.direccion: Convento de Santa Clara. Campo de las Monjas, 1

The museum is closed on Mondays and on the days leading up to Holy Week; this is because the items which are normally housed in the museum are taken out and used for the reenactments over the Easter period.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Balmaseda History Museum is located inside the church of San Juan del Moral and consists of different sections that immerse visitors in the past and present of this town in the Las Encartaciones area.

 

The tour begins with a series of exhibits from the municipal archive (16th-19th century), including the first elections journal and the account book for the hospital that once stood on Calle Pío Bermejillo. There is also a section dedicated to the town's illustrious figures, such as indianos (people who made their fortunes in the Americas and returned with great wealth), politicians and artists.

 

Another section offers information about the most iconic buildings in Balmaseda. The Holy Week celebrations, local industries and traditions (such as the putxeras, or railway stews), and the town's beret factory, "La Encartada", also have their own special place in the museum itinerary.

datosContacto.direccion: Iglesia de San Juan del Moral (calle Martín Mendia)

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Txakolingunea, the txakoli museum, is on the way into Bakio, an important centre for production of this smooth, young, fruity wine which is so characteristic of the Basque Country. Bakio’s microclimate, its nearness to the sea and the quality of its soil have historically favoured the cultivation of vineyards.

 

The txakoli tradition goes back to the late 14th century in this locality. The txakoli made in Bakio belongs to the Bizkaiko Txakolina denomination of origin, one of the three denominations of this wine that exist in the Basque Country. At Txakolingunea visitors can discover all the secrets of this wine through large-format surround audiovisuals, as well as finding out how wine influences health and even learn some of the basic principles of wine tasting.

 

The museum belongs to the Basque coast line museum network and the Basque network of food and drink museums. Guided tours are also available by arrangement. These include the chance to taste a glass of txakoli from Bakio.

 

All the visits are guided, for groups over 10 persons a previous reservation is required.Txakoli tasting is included in the visit.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Hontza Bizkaia Natural History Museum houses more than 38,000 specimens from different parts of the world and all fields of science.

 

Its permanent exhibition has around 1,500 specimens in 27 groups. There are also temporary exhibitions.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Laboratorium museum in Bergara, housed in the Errekalde palace, tells the story of the Royal Seminary through the original pieces that make up its scientific collection.

It also shows how society has developed over the last 250 years.

Your visit to the museum begins in the garden with botanical species from different continents. You can then journey to the 18th century to help the Elhuyar brothers discover wolfram, find the chemical elements in the periodic table with your fingers and discover animals from Oceania, Asia and the Americas.

It also runs popular science programmes for adults, educational workshops, summer science camps and visits to the historic town centre and nature excursions.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Santurtzi is a locality whose history has always been linked to the sea. Its location on the left bank of the Abra estuary, home today to the port of Bilbao, made it a landmark among the fishing and seafaring towns and villages dotted along the Basque coastline.

 

The museum is housed in the former fishermen’s association, right on the harbour. It is a building that symbolises the seafaring history of Santurtzi, and has been fully refurbished. The subject matter of the Santurtzi Itsasoa visitor centre presents the link between Santurtzi and the sea in all its forms, both professional and social, cultural and recreational.

 

As it is a visitor centre, much of its work is aimed at providing experiences related to the sea and the life of its people. Thus, visitors can take part in themed guided tours, guided tastings, auctions, nautical workshops and more (some of them have to be booked in advance).

 

Santurtzi Itsasoa Museoa belongs to the Basque Coast Museums network, a set of cultural and educational spaces spread all along the coastal landscape of the Basque Country and home to a rich, outstanding seafaring heritage that is both protected and studied.

 

Fees: Between 18 and 65 years old: 1.50€; between 5 and 17 years old, over-65s and students 1€. On Wednesdays free.

Easter season, July and August: every day from 10:00am to 7:00pm

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Gerediaga Assembly Hall, located in Abadiño, is the place where representatives from the district of Durango used to gather to make decisions about important matters.

 

This Assembly Hall is, together with those in Gernika and Abellaneda, the official headquarters of the General Assemblies of Bizkaia, known for being the oldest parliament in Europe. It therefore has great historical value. You can visit both the Ermita de San Salvador y San Clemente, a chapel containing beautiful sculptures, and La Campa Foral de Gerediaga, the outdoor meeting area which still has the stone seats where for centuries each representative of the district sat. Various informational panels in Spanish, Basque and English have been installed in the Campa Foral, which feature illustrations from the painter Imanol Larrinaga.

 

They explain the history and evolution of the Assembly Hall in detail. Other highlights include the symbolic Roble foral oak tree and the cross which dates back to 1633 and which can be seen on the outside. The Campa is also in a lovely setting, offering wonderful views to the Anboto Mountain and the Urkiola Natural Park.

datosArteCultura.horario:

Saturday and Sunday: 10am - 7pm

datosGenerales.nombre: The Dolomite Museum, a journey into the past
datosGenerales.descripcion:
In a setting characterised by beautiful landscapes and natural diversity.

 

Visitors can find a vestige of what was once the economic and social heart of the Carranza valley, the Dolomite Museum.

 

Industrial heritage that, rather than being forgotten and giving all the attention to the stunning Armañón nature park, has been restored to help to understand the history of what is traditionally a mining area.

 

At the peak of Basque industry in the 20th century, the hamlet of Ambasaguas was the nerve centre of the area thanks to this factory, which processed the dolomite from Peña Ranero (now in the Armañón nature park).

 

The raw material was carried from the quarry to the factory on an aerial tramway running 2.9 kilometres and shipping up to 90 containers an hour. It was in fact during work in the quarry that the stunning Caves of Pozalagua were discovered. The new discovery was so unique that mining work had to be stopped in the area to preserve the caves, until the factory closed in 1990 after over 40 years in operation.

 

With a fifth of the original structure still standing, the factory, listed by the Basque government in 2002 as a Cultural Asset in the Monument category, instead of being demolished and forgotten has been reopened as a museum. A museum that, rather than detracting from its natural setting, complements the landscape to show visitors the real essence of the area. A site that commemorates not only the industrial revolution of its time, but also the stories of the hundred of families who made a living there.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
A visit to the Barandiaran museum is a journey into the heart of Basque culture. Situated in the magical locality of Ataun (Gipuzkoa), it offers visitors the chance to discover the life and above all the extensive work and writings of the celebrated Basque priest, anthropologist and ethnologist José Miguel de Barandiaran.

Ataun, the village where Barandiaran was born and lived for much of his life, is in an unparalleled natural setting that has yielded a host of historical treasures including Roman coins, dolmens and caves, among other things. Relics of days gone by that are also accompanied by stories and legends passed down from generation to generation by the inhabitants of the locality, closely tied to farming and stockbreeding.

 

It is this traditional culture that the mountains of Sarastarri, Areetza and Aitxu have preserved over the centuries that first attracted the young Barandiaran to Basque ethnography and archaeology. From his birth in 1889 to his death in 1991 at the age of 101, this famous researcher devoted his life to excavating numerous dolmens and caves. But above all, Barandiaran studied the history and the magical legends that accompanied these discoveries. This Basque anthropologist worked to set down on paper the hundreds of tales that lived on in the memory of the villagers, making him the father of Basque mythology.

 

And it is this mythology that is the star of the Barandiaran museum. In it visitors have the chance to discover Basque folklore in a thought-provoking way, with feelings and imagination playing a starring role. The restored 17th-century mill of Larruntza is a place to find out all about the scholar's life, as if you were right there beside him.

 

In short, a visit to the museum and a stroll around Ataun give you the chance not only to see but to feel the mystery and the beauty of the ancient legends that once captivated this scholar. Tales that, thanks to José Miguel de Barandiaran, will not vanish away with the passing of time, but will last for ever in our collective memory.

datosArteCultura.horario: 2021 calendar.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Sheltered by the imposing Entzia range of hills, the “Eginoko Artzaia” Cheese Centre is in the village of Egino, a place with a long sheep-rearing tradition.

 

It is precisely this ancient activity that gives it a unique attraction, “Eginoko Artzaia” cheese, which you can now discover at this visitor centre, opened in 2015. This cheese, which bears the Idiazabal designation of origin, is made with milk from sheep of the Latxa breed reared in nearby meadows, and is of outstanding quality.

 

At the “Eginoko Artzaia” Cheese Centre, visitors have the chance to discover a place where tradition and modernity go hand in hand to prove that customs need not lose their authenticity with the passing of the years. Traditional tools and old pictures are on display together with modern videos and digital presentations showing just how the product is made. The exhibition area is overlooked by a large mural portraying the couple who founded the cheese making operation together with their flock, as well as the inside of their hut.

 

Another highlight is a video of the flock coming down from the hills, an orthophoto of Entzia with lots of place names and a digital presentation about the hill shepherds as they were a few decades ago. The materials on display in the centre enable you to find out all about not just the cheese but also the village of Egino and its surrounding area. A unique natural setting with prehistoric remains like those found in the Gentiles cave.

datosGenerales.nombre: The Costume Museum, a different view of our past
datosGenerales.descripcion:
In the heart of Errenteria's old town, the 17th-century baroque house Kapitain Etxea houses a treasure trove of textiles: the ‘Jantziaren Zentroa’ Costume Centre. The building, dating from 1638, is a good way of learning about the origins of this town in Gipuzkoa province, making it the ideal place for visitors to discover a different view of history, one that's both unique and fun. Jantziaren Zentroa offers the chance to appreciate our culture, customs and tastes from the 16th to the 20th century, through the rich fabrics, colours and patterns of the clothes on show.

 

All this is thanks to the work of Iraultza Dantza Taldea, which has studied Basque dress for 20 years, seeking information in photographic archives, documents and publications and examining original clothing. In order to explain each costume and its time, the fashion of the day in Europe was studied.

 

The permanent exhibition is divided into two rooms. In the "Indumentaria popular" or "Ordinary Clothing" room you can see clothes worn by ordinary people in the 19th and 20th centuries. Most of the items are donated by families in the Basque Country. Upstairs, the exhibition entitled “Evolución de la indumentaria” or "Evolution of Clothing", offers a brief review of fashion from the 18th to 20th centuries, with garments worn by noble, bourgeois or well-off families and acquired by Iraultza dantza taldea over the years.

 

Moreover, Jantziaren Zentroa has reproduced five sets of women's clothing from the 16th to 20th centuries. These are divided in half: on one side you can see the clothes from the outside, as in the exhibition rooms, and on the other the hidden part of the costume - all the parts that give it shape and volume, frames and ways of fastening the clothing. These costumes are an option for blind people or those with reduced visibility, as they can be touched to feel what is being talked about.

 

Jantziaren Zentroa also offers visitors the chance to experience the feel of the clothing. At the end of the visit there is a 19th-century oak wardrobe; visitors opening it are invited to try on the clothes inside and see their "new" look in a mirror.

 

Entrance: 3 euros, free for children under 5 years old.

 

The centre opens on Saturday mornings and afternoons from 11am to 2pm and from 5 to 8pm, and on Sundays and public holidays from 11am to 2pm.

 

There will be guided tours in Basque and Spanish, for a price of 5 euros if a group of 5 people can be made up, by prior arrangement: call the Errenteria tourist office on 943 49 45 21 or Jantziaren Zentroa on 943 44 96 92.

 

On the first Sunday in the month there is a tour in Basque, and on the second one in Spanish.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Housed in the cave of Los Judíos in the hamlet of Sangrices, Kobenkoba is the first palaeolithic cave art visitor centre in Europe. A cultural and tourist project that offers visitors an authentic journey into the palaeolithic world and the chance to discover the art left on the walls of caves and rocky outcrops all over the continent between 35,000 and 10,000 years ago.

 

The cave is divided into three different areas. The entrance hall shows the everyday life of palaeolithic people and the singular creations of prehistoric artists. In the North Room, visitors can enjoy an audiovisual show explaining how artists in the glacial period created their cave carvings and paintings. And finally, in the South Gallery, is the Cave Art Gallery, which brings together replicas of some of the most important sets of artwork in Europe.

 

Moreover, Kobenkoba offers the chance to take part in children's activities like the spray-painting workshop, where they can experience one of the painting techniques used by our ancestors in palaeolithic times.

datosContacto.direccion: Cueva de Los Judíos. Barrio Sangrices

datosArteCultura.horario: Visits by prior arrangement via the above telephone number.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Aguinaga Museum of Barakaldo is the perfect place to get lost in Mercedes-Benz’s history and to see vehicles ranging from their oldest model, dating back to 1926, to several cars from the 1980s. A temple to the automotive sector with an area of more than 2,000 m2 divided into three areas: the exhibition, the garage and the events hall.

 

This is a museum for all engine lovers, where they can discover the secrets of these German classics from within. The exhibition explores Mercedes-Benz’s history and evolution through the different vehicles displayed.

 

The museum, designed with the utmost attention to detail, offers an opportunity to learn the values behind one of the most important manufacturers in the international automotive industry. There is also a space to host meetings, workshops and events, and a garage for the repair of classic vehicles staffed by experienced mechanics.

datosArteCultura.horario:
Saturdays from 10.00am to 1.00pm.

Closed in August.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Iron Belt was a big line designed during the Civil war to defend Bilbao and his municipalities, in case the pro-Franco army was exceeding the fronts protected by the Basque troops.

 

This belt would defend the most important places to maintain lively a besieged city: ports, airfields, reservoirs...

 

It was built between 1936 and 1937 by 10.000 Basques men and women during the order of Basque Country President, Jose Antonio Aguirre. It was formed by the mountains that were surrounding the city, a network of trenches, machine gunners nests, wire fences and diverse defensive elements.

 

Thanks to the information facilitated by the traitor captain Goicoechea, the pro-Franco army discovered the weak points of the defensive belt and in June, 1937 crossed it for one of them in the Larrabetzu locality.

 

Memorial Museum of Iron Belt keeps alive the memory of all those persons who died by the Civil War. It is located in the Cultural Center of Berango, next to the nest of machine fun of the Iron Belt of Berango and Sopela.

 

In the visit to museum, across a clear and modern scenery, it will be possible to know how and why the Iron Belt was built, also to enjoy a movie and go through all the remains that stay of the same one.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Navaridas Interpretation Centre is located in the former Casa Palacio de los Sodupe in the municipality of Alava. 

 

This centre provides an area to discover the way of life of the inhabitants of the Alto de Castejón in Navaridas, an archaeological site discovered in 2014 and declared a Site of Cultural Interest. 

 

Through 8 slides: El Poblado, El Territorio, La Agricultura y la Ganadería, La Caza, El Agua, Las Manufacturas y Las Defensas the most relevants aspects of the life of this area of Alava are recreated, between the 9th and 5th centuries BC, at the most representative moment of the village. 

 

The exhibition also covers an extensive historical period spanning more than five thousand years: from Neolithic to the end of the Middle Ages, always faithful to the archaeological findings made at the site.

datosArteCultura.horario:
It is possible guided tours. Free access. Visit by appointment 24 hours in advance. Call from Monday to Friday to the City Hall of Navaridas from 9:30 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.


to 945605053.

datosGenerales.nombre: Romanesque in Alava: Shrine of Nuestra Señora de Estibaliz and Romanesque Interpretation Centre
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Shrine of Nuestra Señora de Estíbaliz is one of the most representative buildings of the Middle Ages in the Basque Country, the site where the medieval carving of the patron saint of Álava is kept.

 

Located in Argandoña, just 10 kilometers from Vitoria-Gasteiz, this jewel of Basque Romanesque architecture is a mid-17th-century construction with late Gothic elements. It has a Latin cross plan divided into three naves and the head of three apses.

 

The modern Romanesque Interpretation Centre in Alava is located near the Shrine which, through its 4 rooms, shows in an organized and didactic way the characteristics of the Romanesque style and its presence in the Historical Territory of Alava.

 

In the first room the particularities of this artistic style born in medieval Europe are revealed, the second room shows the peculiarities of the Romanesque Alaves, the third takes into account the orography of the territory and the diffusion of this art through it and finally the fourth room focuses exclusively on the Shrine of Nuestra Señora de Estíbaliz, a jewel of the Romanesque style of Alaves and the Basque Country in general.

 

The site, surrounded by forest where the Shrine and the Interpretation Centre are located, is an excellent starting point to get to know the Romanesque routes in Alava and has a car park, children´s playgrounds, picnic area, pelota court and bar with a terrace.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Museum of Artistic Reproductions of Bilbao, one of the oldest in the city, was created in 1927 with the aim of completing the cultural offer of the town and helping the students of Fine Arts to learn.

 

Since its foundation, the museum has has different venues until it was definitively housed in the Neo-Gothic Church of the Heart of Mary. This location provides a special atmosphere to his works as seen in the temple where his main exhibition is exhibited.

 

From the very beginning, the promoters of this Museum gave priority to the quality of the works they wanted to reproduce rather than to quantity. The first works arrived from Madrid, among them: David de Verrochio, El Niño de la Espina, El Torso de Belvedere… Later arrived other replicas of European museums, for example, from Vaticamo Laocoön and His Sons or Apollo Belvedere, and from Louvre Museum in Paris The Venus de Nilo and Victory of Samothrace.

 

In short, this is one of the oldest museums in the Biscayan capital, where you can discover works of the great classics of extraordinary quality whose originals are in the best museums in Europe.

 

Guided tours are offered free of charge on the first and last Fridays and Saturdays of each month, provided that there is a minimum of 5 people to do so and with prior reservation on 946 790 255.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Bengola renewable energy visitor centre is in the municipality of Munitibar at the bottom of the mountain of Oiz. The wind farms in the provide a good example for Bengola's mission: showing visitors the origin and importance of renewable energies.

 

People visiting the centre will learn about the use of clean energies today, but also in the past, especially in mills and ironworks.

 

Moreover, as it is at one end of the Lea trail, Bengola is also a visitor centre for this route, the Lea area and its heritage and characters.

Fagus Alkiza is the name of the visitor centre for Hernio-Gazume, a limestone massif covering 2,158 hectares with its karst topography making up an area of outstanding ecological and landscape value.

 

The contents of the Fagus Alkiza visitor centre are organised in three basic areas:

  • Nature, with information about the biodiversity of Hernio Gazume, listed as a Special Conservation Area as the habitat of insects that break down dead wood, chiroptera (bats) and raptors (griffon vulture and Egyptian vulture).
  • Human beings and their sustainable relationship with this setting: the meadows, the pollard beeches, the charcoal kilns (txondorrak) and the lime kilns (karobiak), among other things.
  • The third aim of Fagus Alkiza is to foster culture in an inclusive sense in the countryside, creating a place for reflection and meetings between people who live from agriculture, lovers of nature and the mountains, artists and so on.

 

To find out about all this at first hand, various footpaths set out from the centre, of varying levels of difficulty, passing waterfalls and streams, farmhouses, beech woods and crags inhabited by birds of prey.

Ur Mara is a museum devoted to the work of the artist Koldobika Jauregi and his concerns, including ecology, ethnography, nature, philosophy and poetry.

 

Koldobika Jauregi is a multi-faceted artist, he has no hesitation in moving between tradition and modernity and his work can be seen in museums such as the Guggenheim Bilbao. He has been recognised by artists like Chillida, who awarded him the Zabalega scholarship, named after the house that is home to Chillida Leku.

 

Koldobika Jauregi, together with his wife Elena Cajaraville, took part for several years in the "Art Parallel to Nature" project at the Insel Hombroich museum in Germany, set up by Karl-Henrich Müller. The Ur Mara museum was born out of that experience.

 

This is why the rooms in the museum are not the typical white cubes, but fit into the native forest: among beeches, oaks, ash, chestnut and birches are sculptures and installations, a natural auditorium and also ethnographic pieces like an old lime kiln next to the small limestone quarry.

datosArteCultura.horario: Open all year with guided tour

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Izki Natural Park Visitor Centre is located in the small village of Korres, part of the municipality of Arraia-Maeztu and the only settlement within the boundaries of the protected area.

 

The centre welcomes visitors, offering them information of all kind, including about the network of paths that make it possible to discover Izki on foot, on horseback or by bicycle.

 

Visitors can take a look at its permanent exhibition to find out about the wide variety of ecosystems (rivers, woods, wetlands and crags), the wildlife living in the park (mammals like the wildcat, birds like the peregrine falcon, the Egyptian vulture, the griffon vulture or the short-toed eagle and a wide variety of reptiles, amphibians and insects), as well as the plant life to be found in its extensive woods: beeches, kermes oaks, alders, gall oaks, mixed forest, birches, aspen and oaks. It also provides information about the uses and sustainable exploitation of the area by humans.

 

The visitor centre also organises activities and guided tours, school activities and awareness raising campaigns.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Sintonía arrecifal ("Reef Symphony") is the name of the "art and nature observatory-gallery" created in the Geranda quarry in Ereño. It is a land art project create by LePatafisicCabinet, made up of the artists Rober Garay and Alber Palomera, which features contemporary artworks in a venue packed with symbolism for the area.

 

The exhibition, which consists of ten installations, is inspired by the creatures that lives in the reef that ended up becoming, over millions of years, the famous red marble of Ereño.

 

By observing the graphic imprint of these creatures recorded at the bottom of our seas, their place in the fossil record and the different angles in the sections of rudists, ostreids and other molluscs, LePatafisicCabinet has created a dialogue between the ancient reef and our own time, perpetuating their languages forever in stone.

The Valderejo nature park visitor centre is located on the outskirts of the locality of Lalastra, handy for the main hiking routes in the park, among them the gorge of the river Purón.

 

At the back of the building is a hide from which to spot the smaller birds living in the park and a great taster for birding enthusiasts, who will also find an excellent hide in Vallegrull, looking towards the vulture feeding area.

 

Close to the visitor centre there is a recreation area with tables and benches under a structure to provide shade and protection from the rain.

datosGenerales.nombre: Arditurri - Aiako Harria nature park centre
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Arditurri, the Aiako Harria nature park centre, is located at one of the ways into this area, in the heart of its rocky massif.

The centre is in fact in the building that formerly housed the laboratories of the Arditurri mines, next to the mine entrance.

Arditurri is one of the few mine galleries to have been worked almost continuously for 2,000 years. Today, after over 20 years in disuse, the mine site has been restored so that you can visit a landscape whose surface is marked by towering slag heaps, open-cast quarries, inclines and cuttings, mine entrances, old mine buildings and even the route of the railway on which the mineral was shipped to the port of Pasaia, today converted into a walking and cycling path.

Through information panels and touch screens as well as other technological devices, the park centre enables visitors to discover the history of the Aiako Harria nature park and the Arditurri mines before plunging inside them in the old gallery.

datosGenerales.nombre: Toki-Alai, Urkiola nature park reception and visitor centre
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Toki-Alai, Urkiola nature park reception and visitor centre, is just 200 metres from the top of the Urkiola pass on the way up to the peak of Saibigain, in a setting that offers stunning views of the park, with the sanctuary church of Urkiola in the foreground and the ridge between Alluitz and Anboto.

 

Toki-Alai organises informative, educational and discovery activities To do this it has a permanent exhibition where the highlights include a stuffed bear, the last to inhabit these mountains 150 years ago.

 

During the academic year the centre hosts school visits as part of its educational programme and at weekends it runs a programme of activities open to the general public, such as bird watching, mushroom identification and guided routes.

 

Moreover, visitors to Toki-Alai can get information about various circular routes to discover the landscapes and environment of the Urkiola nature park, at different levels of difficulty, from family routes visiting legendary settings like Baltzola to going round Anboto or climbing to its legendary peak.

 

Outside Toki-Alai there are charcoal-burning structures called txondorrak, while around the nearby farmstead of Letona-Korta - used for school programmes, conferences, talks and exhibitions - there are some spectacular trees such as an ancient yew.

The visitor centre for the Armañón nature park and the Ordunte special conservation area (SCA) is located in front of the entrance to the Pozalagua cave, in the former mineral crushing station of the Dolomitas del Norte quarry.

 

The permanent exhibition at Parketxe Armañon focuses on the wonderful richness of this area, including a virtual overflight of its mountains, discovering its rich flora and fauna, native breeds, the amazing world underground - and descending 40 metres below the earth to enjoy a unique 3D experience.

 

During the academic year the centre hosts school visits as part of its educational programme and at weekends it runs a programme of activities open to the general public, such as guided tours of the exhibition, games and workshops for families and activities to care for the environment.

 

Moreover, visitors to the Parketxe can find out about some of the best routes to choose from in Armañón, some of them setting out from the Parketxe itself, including several through the Sopeña holm oak woods, the circular to Ranero and paths leading to some of the dolmens and burial mounds to be found in the area.

 

It also offers information about the swallow holes, pits and caves to be found around and under Armañón, from the world-famous Pozalagua to La Torca del Carlista and Venta La Perra.

datosArteCultura.horario:
Tuesday to Sunday 10am - 2pm and 4pm - 6pm.

in July and August open every day.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Perched on the pass from which it takes its name, Lizarrusti is the reception and visitor centre for the Aralar nature park and the starting point for walks along the Lareo trail or the ascent of Txindoki.

 

Lisarrusti has a room equipped to awaken visitors' sensations to give them an idea of what can be found in the Aralar nature park. Other rooms include one to find out about mountain routes and another with games.

 

Also, in collaboration with the Joxe Miel Barandiaran museum, the centre runs activities aimed at highlighting the essence of the natural and cultural heritage of the Aralar nature park, the features of the environment and their relationship with the people who live there.

 

Among other facilities, the building houses a hostel.

This Parketxe, in the square in Areatza, in the Arratia valley in Bizkaia province, houses the Gorbeia nature park visitor centre. Together with the visitor centre in the locality of Sarria in Alava province, this is a place to discover the biggest nature park in the Basque Country.

 

The centre is in a three-storey building that simulates an ascent to the legendary cross atop Gorbeia. Thus, each floor is related to a different altitude:

 

  • Ground floor (0-500 m). The subsoil and lowland area: rivers and river banks, the power of water, villages, hay meadows and so on.
  • First floor (500-1000 m). The forest world and its inhabitants. Forestry, geological formations.
  • Second floor (1000-1481 m). Crags and their fantastic shapes, caves and the mountain meadow leading up to the cross.

 

As well as the exhibition and an educational programme for school groups, Parketxe Areatza organises activities including one-day tourist routes in and around the park, with visits to other museums in the area and a chance to see traditional trades, as well as environmental routes in different parts of the Gorbeia nature park: Ojo de Atxulaur and Superlegor, Arraba and Kargaleku, Saldropo and Paso de Atxuri.

datosArteCultura.horario: Every day from 10am to 2pm and from 4pm to 6 pm

datosGenerales.nombre: Iturraran, Pagoeta nature park visitor centre
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Pagoeta nature park has a visitor centre at Iturraran, a beautiful 18th-century farmstead which conserves its original wooden structure.

 

Parketxe Iturraran houses a permanent exhibition about the physical and ethnographical context of Pagoeta. It also offers an educational workshop and various interactive media, thanks to which visitors can see the balance that exists between nature and the human activities carried on sustainably over the centuries.

 

But without a doubt one of the great attractions of Iturraran is the botanical garden surrounding the centre. It covers an area of 25 hectares, 10 of them with native plants, and it currently has a collection of about 5,500 taxons, most of them trees and shrubs from different parts of the world. At one end of the garden is the Biodiversity Garden, which boasts a fine collection of threatened plants from the Basque Country.

 

Two other places nearby that are well worth visiting are the educational beehive and the ironworks and mills of Agorregi.

Antzasti Euskaldunon Etxea is in the locality of Dima, in the south-east of Bizkaia province, in a unique setting surrounded by one of the most distinctive mountain ranges in the Basque Country, at the gateway to the Urkiola nature park and facing the Gorbeia nature park. 

 

There the sisters Cristina and Elena Amezaga have created a museum of enormous anthropological value to explain everyday life and the role of women in town and country environments in the course of the 19th and 20th centuries.

 

Antzasti uses a 360º tour to present the contrasting settings of a farmstead in Arratia (the building in which the museum is housed) and a middle-class home in nineteenth-century Bilbao, in perfect harmony, using a vast collection of materials. Through the point of view of a woman, the centre of domestic life, a tour reveals the contrasts between the rooms in the two homes.

 

Antzasti is a time capsule that, through carefully decorated and contextualised settings, shows what life, leisure and work were like in this period of our history.

datosArteCultura.horario: Prior reservations are required to visit the museum-house, as a guided tour is provided.

datosGenerales.nombre: Konsoni Lantegia - Basque Country Industrial Movable Heritage Deposit
datosGenerales.descripcion:
Konsoni Lantegia is a warehouse where the Basque Government Department of Culture and Linguistic Policy stores all the industrial movable material considered to be Cultural Heritage.

Visitors to this old store located in the area of Zorrozaurre in Bilbao can find around 2000 items: old motorbikes, fire trucks, linotype machines and printing press material, remains of the mining industry and its auxiliary sector, anchors, a port crane, engines, hydraulic presses, models...

This extensive list will certainly amaze visitors, either because they remember these items from days gone by or because it dawns on them that this cultural heritage is as unfamiliar as it is surprising.

Visiting the School of 1950 in Legazpi is like going into a black and white film.

 

Slate pencils, desks and encyclopaedias... every detail has its place in rigorous order, taking visitors on a journey back in time to the school of the 50s, where rigidity, discipline and religion were the principal values and where boys and girls went to different schools and each child received an education aimed at fulfilling their "function" in society. 

 

The School of 1950 is part of Lenbur Fundazioa and features in a working-class route together with resources like the Worker's Home and the Chillida Lantoki workshop.

The Worker's Home in Legazpi takes visitors back to a time when thousands of families were coming to the Basque Country in search of a job and a better future. This is essential to understand the history of a town that, like many others, was transformed with the appearance of new factories.

 

Going through the door means entering a real home as it was in the 50s, restored to help understand what life was like for a working family at the time: no television, no fridge, no washing machine... where lodgers or neighbours sharing the kitchen rubbed shoulders with the tenants who worked in the factory.

Lagum offers a journey through Rioja Alavesa from prehistory to the present day. Its aim is to maintain, preserve and publicise its history and cultural identity.

 

It has three different areas to take visitors on a journey from prehistory to the 21st century on the basis of a highly distinctive collection.

 

It runs educational visits, group visits and educational workshops.

Arekestamendi is the renewable energy park in Amurrio, an open-air exhibition space covering 22,600 m2 aimed at sharing knowledge about renewable energies in a fun, educational way.

 

It is devoted to the air, the sun, water and biomass and has 26 energy devices with which people of all ages can find out how the sun can tell the time and how windmills have been used since prehistoric times, as well as drawing water from a well or lighting a bulb by pedalling.

 

A spiral wooden walkway nearly 1 km long leads to the different areas, where as well as numerous participative artefacts visitors can see models and panels explaining different sources of energy.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Sarria nature park centre or Parketxe is the visitor centre for the Álava side of the Gorbeia nature park, in the municipality of Zuia. Together with the visitor centre in the locality of Areatza in Bizkaia province, this is the place to discover the biggest nature park in the Basque Country.

 

The Sarria visitor centre is in the spot known as Central de Baias, where the river of the same name runs beside the path leading to the mountain of Gorbeia. The visitor centre in fact offers different routes to climb Gorbeia, from family-friendly ones like the Zarate or Murua paths to that of Atxuri, of some technical difficulty but extremely beautiful.

 

During the academic year the centre hosts school visits as part of its educational programme. It also runs a programme of activities open to the general public, highlights of which include watching the deer roaring in the Gorbeia nature park. This is a natural phenomenon that takes place in September and which can be spotted from specific observation points in small-group visits for between fifteen and twenty people, by prior arrangement.

 

The Sarria visitor centre can be reached by car and has leisure facilities including tables, toilets, a small bothy and a children's playground.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Arantzazu nature park centre or Parketxe is the gateway to the Aizkorri-Aratz nature park from the area of the sanctuary church of Arantzazu, in the locality of Oñati.

 

As well as being the visitor information and reception centre, over 600 square metres of floor space spread over three storeys in the Gandiaga Topagunea II building offer visitors the chance to find out about the distinctive features of the park thanks to a permanent exhibition, teaching rooms and interactive panels.

datosArteCultura.horario: Thursday to Sunday: 10:00 - 14:00

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Kantauri Ondare Museoa is a small museum in Zumaia. It displays treasures related to ships and shipbuilding. This maritime heritage includes pieces that you can usually only see in films: century-old compasses and old anchors, ship's wheels and more.  

 

These exhibits reveal the importance of this industry in Zumaia both then and now, in particular marine engines.

Located in the heart of the mining area and the biotope, Ekoetxea Meatzaldea is a facility for information, education and environmental awareness.

 

It has two sites: one in Ortuella (Peñas Negras) and the other in Abanto-Zierbena (Gallarta), two strategic points for appreciating and enjoying the unique landscape full of contrasts.

 

The exploitation of iron until the beginning of the 20th century has left traces in a large area of north-western Bizkaia, whose values are associated with mining activity and the legacy it has left behind. Countless remains of infrastructures, artificial lakes or shafts and other elements have created this peculiar landscape.

 

With the aim of showing the geodiversity, biodiversity and all the cultural heritage of the mining area, Ekoetxea Meatzaldea consists of exhibitions, rooms with audiovisual content and free activities for families and the general public.

datosContacto.direccion: Bº Campo Diego, s/n. Edificio Korta

datosGenerales.nombre: Mufomi - Elgoibar Fossil and Mineral Museum
datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Mufomi Museum of Fossils and Minerals opened its doors in 1994, the result of the hard work of the Leizarpe group of speleologists. Speleology is home to many sciences and the following three branches are developed in the Elgoibar museum: geology, mineralogy and palaeontology.

 

Visitors to Mufomi can discover fossils and minerals extracted from caves,
caverns and chasms in the surrounding area, which are exhibited 
in display cases ranging in age from the Pleistocene to the Anthropocene.

 

In addition, the recreation of a 45-metre long cavern has recently been opened to the public in four rooms. The first room is the entrance to the cave, where you can see stalactites, stalagmites, banners, eccentrics and all kinds of speleothems.

 

The next is the Neanderthal room, where you will find replicas of cave paintings supposedly made by Neanderthals 68,000 years ago. The third room is called the Sistine Chapel and is dedicated to Palaeolithic art, with paintings dating from 32,000 to 12,000 years ago.

 

Finally, there is the Mediterranean room, with schematic paintings depicting humans, hunting and gathering, dances and religious beliefs for the first time.

datosArteCultura.horario:
Weekdays: 18:00-20:00 h.

Weekends - Holidays:11:00-14:00 h.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The Archaelogical Museum  inaugurated in 2009, is the centre of reference and promoter of archaeological research in Bizkaia. 

 

Located in the Calzadas de Mallona, in the heart of Bilbao's Old Quarter, it covers 3,000 square metres spread over five floors and has a threefold mission: to conserve the prehistoric legacy of the territory, research and cataloguing it and its dissemination and enhancement among the people. The latter is carried out through the activities organised by the museum. 

 

It is also equipped with multimedia equipment consisting of 19 interactive pieces and 5 audiovisuals that help visitors to the museum to understand the content of each section.

 

Permanent exhibition

The permanent exhibition consists of some 500 pieces, the oldest of which are more than 75,000 years old. These pieces show what daily life was like for humans in the historical territory more than 100,000 years ago and up to historical times. 

 

The museum also has an important collection of funerary stelae dating from the 1st to 4th centuries AD.

 

Price: 

  • General admission 3 €.
  • Reduced rate 1,5 €.
  • School groups 1 € per pupil.
  • Free for children under 12 and Museum Day (Fridays).

datosArteCultura.horario: From Tuesday to Saturday: 10:00 - 14:00 / 16:00 to 19:30

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The ethnographic and cultural museum of Orduña is located in one of the most beautiful natural sites in the Basque Country: Sierra Salvada.

It shows the ethnography of the town through a collection of pieces and objects donated or donated by people linked to the town, which are exhibited in 12 rooms dedicated to different trades and activities: Tailors and Dressmakers, Confectionery, Music, Pottery, Apothecary, Weavers, Saddlery, Shoemakers, Bicycles, Cinema, Txistus and Lingerie.

The Museum of Orduña also has an ambitious programme of temporary exhibitions and cultural activities, with 3 halls dedicated to artistic exhibitions of different disciplines, antiques, concerts, conferences, screenings, workshops, etc.

Located in the building of the 19th century "public schools", within the foundational nucleus of the city. Its architecture contrasts with the presence of the church-fortress and the wall of Santa María, highlighting its façade painted with a ground-breaking design.

Its permanent collection takes us into the trades, crafts and traditions of Orduña over the last few centuries. A look back that thrills the elderly and intrigues the young. Its temporary exhibitions and activities give it a cultural dynamic of great interest.

datosArteCultura.horario:

Saturdays: 11:00 to 14:00 / 17:00 to 20:00
